* Driva och facilitera arbetet med att analysera nuvarande arbetssätt och ta fram agila strategier och förändringsplaner som ökar IT-organisationens effektivitet och förbättrar det tvärfunktionella samarbetet.
* Säkerställa att agila metoder (t.ex. SAFe, LeSS, Scrum@Scale, Spotify-modellen) anpassas till verksamhetens behov.
* Leda förändringen och den kulturella omställningen.
* Identifiera hinder på organisatorisk nivå och facilitera lösningar.
* Utvärdera och förbättra den agila mognaden i IT-organisationen.
* Utbilda i agila metoder, mindset och principer


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Högskoleutbildning om minst 120p/180hp inom IT, alternativt motsvarande relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som agil coach
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att ha lett agilt förändringsarbete i medelstora eller stora organisationer (minst 500 medarbetare)
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att coacha ledningsgrupper inom agila arbetssätt
* Erfarenhet av minst 3 agila ramverk och metoder (t ex Scrum, Kanban, LEAN, SAFe LeSS, Scrum@Scale, Spotify-modellen )
* Minst 15 års erfarenhet av workshopledning
* Minst 15 års erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Dokumenterad närvaro i relevanta forum inom det agila området och bland annat lett kurser och föreläst på konferenser inom det området vid minst fem tillfällen.
* Behärska svenska språket i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Minst två års erfarenhet som agil coach i offentlig sektor.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Tekniska testare & Testautomatiserare
description:
Avegas bolag inom Quality Assurance & Test utvecklas starkt och vi söker nu specialistkonsulter som vill visa våra kunder vägen till ett modernt kvalitetsarbete. Våra kunder är utvecklingsorganisationer inom alla olika branscher som strävar mot högre effektivitet och ökad kvalitet. Det är därför vi behöver dig som vet att QA är så mycket mer än Test, att kvalitet inte går att testa in i slutet, utan kräver ett helhetstänk som genomsyrar hela utvecklingsprocessen.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken och brinner för teknik, säkerhet och effektiv kvalitetssäkring. Som kan vägleda kunden i deras kvalitetsresa, genom att exempelvis införa automatiserade tester, arbeta med DevOps, AI, säkerhetstester och monitorering/loggning.
 



  





 Vi tror på att lärande är en livslång process och satsar därför på att hjälpa våra redan erfarna specialister att fortsätta utvecklas. Vårt fokus är allas kontinuerliga kompetensutveckling och vårt mål är att vara våra medarbetares mest utvecklande arbetsplats i karriären.
 



  





 Vår matchningsprincip 1:1 innebär att vi strävar efter 100% matchning mellan våra kompetenser och våra kunders utmaningar – vi är aktivt med och väljer våra konsultuppdrag för att uppnå kontinuerlig utveckling och engagemang. För oss är rätt utmaning för varje individ avgörande för att lyckas i rollen.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Minst fem års arbetserfarenhet inom test och QA
* Akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, IT eller likvärdigt
* Du har med fördel erfarenhet från och förståelse för systemutveckling
* Du har erfarenhet av testautomatisering på olika nivåer (front-end, API etc.)
* Kunna bygga pipelines och införa testexekvering i en CI/CD-kontext
* Ha erfarenhet av att planera och designa tester för komplexa system
* Du bemästrar minst ett av dessa verktyg: Cypress, Playwright, Postman; Azure DevOps +++
* Ha arbetat i en agil miljö
* Certifikat inom test (ISTQB)
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som konsult och/eller har erfarenhet av test i komplexa organisationer
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska är ett krav



  





**Meriterande kvalifikationer** 



* Certifikat inom säkerhet och AI samt inom agila arbetssätt, t ex Scrum eller SAFe
* Gärna domänkunskap inom Lumera, SAP eller andra större standardsystem
* Gärna branscherfarenhet inom Retail, Bank/finans/försäkring eller offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av Gen- AI och av icke-funktionella tester, t ex kring säkerhet, prestanda och tillförlitlighet
* Erfarenhet av coachande eller ledande roller för att driva projekt eller verksamhet mot önskad kvalitet.



  





 Vidare vill vi också att du är driven, ambitiös och brinner för digital transformation och kvalitetssäkring lika mycket som vi!
 



  





 Om du är en person som vill vara en del av ett spännande bolag i förändring har du hittat rätt, tveka inte att höra av dig redan idag!

title: Digital Platforms & Performance Manager
description:
**Are you passionate about digital platforms and how they are performing, and eager to make a significant impact in a global community of innovators?**
**At Alleima, we are more than a leading steel company – we are a collective of dedicated professionals working together to transform industries and redefine the future of materials technology. Join us in our journey towards a sustainable future and become part of our legacy as our new Digital Platforms & Performance Manager. Apply today and be a vital part of our story!**
**Placement in Sandviken or Stockholm**
**About The Role**
 As a
 **Digital Platforms & Performance Manager** 
 at Alleima, you will lead the strategic development and performance optimization of our external website and related digital platforms. Your work will ensure that our digital presence reflects Alleima’s brand, supports communication goals, and delivers measurable impact.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Act as product owner for Alleima’s external website and digital platforms, ensuring strategic alignment, usability, and operational excellence.
* Manage external partners and agencies, overseeing development, maintenance, and optimization of digital solutions.
* Lead cross-functional collaboration, representing Group Communications in discussions with IT and other stakeholders to ensure platform stability, security, and scalability.
* Drive development initiatives, including structural updates, redesigns, and AI-driven enhancements to improve user experience and search performance.
* Lead the development and implementation of Alleima’s global communications measurement framework, ensuring data-driven evaluation of digital performance across platforms, campaigns, and events.
* Develop and maintain a communications measurement framework, linking platform activities to brand and engagement objectives.
* Analyze performance data and generate actionable insights, consolidating analytics from web, campaigns, and events into dashboards and reports.
* Support content management and quality assurance, coordinating updates and contributing to best practices for communication measurement and evaluation.


**About You**
 You hold a university degree in communications, marketing, data/system sciences, or a related technical field, ideally combining analytical and communication expertise. And bring solid experience managing digital communication platforms such as corporate websites. You understand how these platforms support brand and communication objectives, and you’re comfortable working with digital analytics tools to track performance and generate actionable insights. Your knowledge spans SEO, GEO targeting, and emerging trends like AI-driven search optimization, and you have a proven ability to translate complex data into clear recommendations that drive strategic decisions. Experience with WeChat or lead generation is a plus, but not a requirement. Strong skills in both Swedish and English, spoken and written, are essential.
   

  

 Your personal qualities are imperative for this position. You thrive in collaborative environments and have experience working with external suppliers, IT teams, and internal stakeholders—preferably within large, international organizations with matrix structures. Your communication skills are strong, both written and verbal, and you’re able to simplify technical concepts for diverse audiences. You’re structured, proactive, and capable of managing multiple priorities. With a keen interest in technology, digital development, and brand-building, you bring an analytical mindset and a sense of accountability to everything you do. A background bridging IT, analytics, and communications is considered a strong advantage
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 —At Alleima, we value transparency, inclusivity, and sustainability. These principles guide our journey across global markets, ensuring our commitment to quality and responsibility.
   

  

 —We are proud of where we've come from but are even more excited about where we are heading. Every role matters, every voice is valued, and every team member plays a vital part in the story we are writing together.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 —Competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**For Questions Regarding The Recruitment Process**
 Sara Kühner, Recruiter , +46 76 495 02 40
   

  

**Union Contacts**
 Maria Sundqvist, Akademikerföreningen, +46 70 651 73 81
   

  

 Kjell-Åke Klockervold, Ledarna, +46 70 314 24 43
   

  

 Mikael Larsson, Unionen, +46 70 307 30 48
   

  

**Please apply before the 16th of November 2025**
 At Alleima, our mission is much more than delivering high-quality products, technology, and processes - working together to develop solutions based on our customer’s needs and thus achieve our business goals, is a better way to describe our daily work. With curious employees and safety as our priority, we create a work environment where you can develop both personally and professionally.
   

  

 With a clear direction for our journey ahead, utilizing our position as a technology leader, progressive customer partner, and sustainability driver, we aim to become an even stronger company in our industry.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on this challenge together with us? Join us on our journey! www.alleima.com

title: Sales Assistant TUMI
description:
**Job Description**
**Key Responsibilities:**
**Performance To Goals**
* Meet and exceed individual and store baseline goals for personal sales and KPI metrics inclusive of conversion, DPT, UPT and Client Data Capture.
* Take pride in work and strive for excellence.
* Take responsibility for performance
* Teamwork:
* Embody the company culture of coaching through fostering Tumi elite and skill practicing continuously with store team and provide constructive feedback to team members.
* Demonstrate organizational core values.
* Demonstrate an openness to new ideas and concepts while quickly learning and applying to the job.
* Complete quarterly goal setting for personal development.


**Communication And Relationship Building**
* Exercise strong verbal and written skills.
* Utilize active listening skills in order to seek understanding of others.
* Able to adjust communication to the intended audience.
* Demonstrate continuous dedication to ethical conduct in completion of job duties.
* Collaborate effectively with others.
* Openness to feedback from supervisors, peers and team.
* Ability to remain calm and deescalate situations.


**Compliance**
* Manage personal timecards to ensure payroll accuracy.
* Stay up to date with all training.
* Complete all assigned tasks and meet deadlines.
* Adhere to all company policies and procedures.


**Visual Merchandising/Client Experience**
* Ensure the store follows the visual guidelines and directives, inclusive of cleanliness standards.
* Enforce excellent client services through the emphasis of utilizing client books, thank you cards and executing event strategies.
* Ensure a consistent superior client experience.


**About The Team**
**Why you'll love working here:**
 At TUMI, you’ll find a dynamic working environment, joining a community where each team member is empowered with an entrepreneurial spirit. Associates are respected as a vital part of the organization and recognized for their contributions. We believe in a workplace that gives every individual the opportunity to make an impact, and our ongoing commitment is to provide all the tools you need to succeed— guidance towards individual career growth, professional training and development initiatives, and a motivating, exciting environment— along with competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits programs.
   

  

**What We Value**
* INNOVATIVE BY NATURE. SUSTAINABLE BY CHOICE. TUMI protects the things that matter most, the things you own and the planet you travel to see. Our planet is an astonishing place and we believe it’s our responsibility to preserve it for travelers of the future. By putting excellence and quality first, we ensure that every TUMI product has lifelong purpose, supported by our rigorous testing standards, exploration of recycled materials, and global repair network.
* PARTNERS WE BELIEVE IN. Staying true to our values by helping take care of the most vulnerable among us aligns with our mission and is a core element of what we do. We focus on three main areas: promoting wellbeing; empowering vulnerable communities; and protecting the earth’s beautiful places. Each year we extend our philanthropic efforts to partners that help better the world. From supporting St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital fight to cure childhood cancer to Waves for Water who provides clean water to communities in need, we proudly stand by the profound changes they enact.
* CULTURE & INCLUSION. As an organization, we are committed to a diverse and vibrant culture, welcoming people from all walks of life. Our long-standing commitment to culture and inclusion empowers each of us to bring our authentic selves and unique differences to work every day.


 The actual rate of pay offered depends on various factors, including qualifications for the position and relevant experience; as well as other legitimate, non-discriminatory business factors specific to the position or location.
   

  

 Tumi is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to promoting and maintaining a work environment in which all applicants, associates, customers, and other individuals are treated with dignity and respect free from unlawful harassment, discrimination, or retaliation.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Understand the TUMI brand and have true passion for the lifestyle, clients, and product assortment.
* Value a collaborative environment and have an openness to feedback.
* The retail team stands, moves around the store, lifts, pushes boxes that weigh 30 pounds, and uses a ladder to complete job duties.
* Have strong sales and client experience, preferably in the luxury market.
* Can demonstrate proven success in meeting sales goals and achieving KPI’s.
* Flexible availability to work nights, weekends, mornings, and holidays as needed.
* Have a strong sense of integrity and an ability to lead by example.
* Have strong time management skills.

title: Processoperatör - Dagskift
description:
**Är du en problemlösare med öga för detaljer som vill arbeta med den senaste tekniken i en högteknologisk miljö?**
 Som processoperatör hos oss på Silex blir du en viktig del av ett världsledande företag inom MEMS-industrin. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en renrumsmiljö och bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens teknik.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Silex och vad vi gör? Läs mer här.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I den här rollen kommer du att arbeta från hjärtat av Silex – i den så kallade ”fabben” – där cirka 180 processoperatörer arbetar i femskift, dygnet runt, året om. Som processoperatör kommer du att vara delaktig i flera olika tillverkningssteg med varierande utrustning i renrumsmiljö.
   

  

 Just nu söker vi personer till dagskiftet: måndag–torsdag 06:50–14:45, fredag 06:50–13:30.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
 Arbetet utförs i renrum med renrumskläder (renrumsdräkt, skyddsglasögon, munskydd etc.). I rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* Processa skivor enligt givna instruktioner i Silex körjournal
* Utföra mikroskopavsyning av enskilda kiselskivor
* Medverka vid och genomföra processkontroller av utrustning
* Arbeta med varierande uppgifter beroende på område – t.ex. SPC:er, maskinbearbetning, kvalitetstestning, mikroskopavsyningar, hantering av kemikalier och ugnar m.m.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har gymnasieexamen
* Talar flytande svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift
* Har erfarenhet från produktion, lager eller annat strukturerat arbete med tydliga rutiner och krav


**Som person är du:**
* Tekniskt intresserad och nyfiken på att lära dig och utvecklas inom en högteknologisk verksamhet
* Noggrann och har en stadig hand för precisionsarbete
* Strukturerad och har förmåga att planera och prioritera ditt arbete
* Lugn, med ett gott humör även i stressiga situationer
* En teamplayer med god samarbetsförmåga som prestigelöst fokuserar på gemensamma mål


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
* Ett nära samarbete med fantastiska kollegor
* Arbete med den allra senaste tekniken inom MEMS
* En plats på ett ledande företag som driver teknikutvecklingen framåt
* Stort kunskapsutbyte med världsledande experter inom MEMS-processintegration och -utveckling


**Om Silex:**
 Silex är världens största och mest avancerade renodlade MEMS-foundry med huvudkontor i Stockholm. MEMS finns i nästan all modern teknik – från personliga enheter och fordonselektronik till medicinsk utrustning och värmehanteringssystem.
   

  

 Med ett team av expertingenjörer, operatörer, tekniker, specialister och andra nyckelpersoner förverkligar Silex idéer och koncept från branschens ledande MEMS-innovatörer.
   

  

 Silex samlar några av de mest talangfulla, nyfikna, visionära och målinriktade personerna för att tillsammans med kunder bryta ny mark och utveckla den senaste MEMS-teknologin för globala tillämpningar. Hos oss arbetar du med världens största teknikföretag och innovationsledare inom medicin, life science, konsumentelektronik, telekommunikation, fordonsindustri och tillverkningsindustri.
   

  

**Övrig information:**
 För att ansöka, ladda upp ditt CV och svara på några korta frågor.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen är kompetensbaserad och kommer inledas med personlighetstest och logiktest. Dessa tester kommer följas av telefonavstämning, gruppintervju och referenstagning. Vi genomför även bakgrundskontroll och drogtest innan anställning. Som arbetsgivare tillämpar vi även slumpmässiga alkohol- och drogtester under anställningen.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan – bli en del av vår spännande resa!**
**About Silex**
 Sweden’s Silex Microsystems manufactures mechanical and electrical systems in micro scale, in the form of MEMS chips. MEMS technology makes it possible to produce pressure sensors that are small enough to be injected into the human bloodstream. Silex was founded in 2000, and now has an annual turnover of approximately SEK 1 billion and 350 employees. With around 80 active customers globally, Silex is one of the world’s leading independent MEMS manufacturers.
   

  

**Silex** 
 is the world’s largest and most advanced pure-play MEMS foundry. With a team of expert engineers, operators, technicians, engineers, support staff, specialists, and much more besides, Silex transforms the visionary ideas of the world’s leading MEMS innovators into reality.

title: Product & Application Expert
description:
**Product & Application Engineer, Heat Transfer**
 Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.
   

  

 As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Product & Application Engineer in our Energy Division, you will provide technical solutions in collaboration with our sales and service teams, focusing on heat transfer products and applications. You will be a key link between our external sales team, customers, and central organization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide technical solutions and support for customer opportunities and quotes
* Assist with technical clarifications and participate in customer meetings
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and claims
* Guide and support parts and service inquiries, including recommending critical spare parts
* Support non-standard order clarifications for the Customer Support team
* Deliver training programs for employees, partners, and customers as a product expert
* Offer technical support to internal teams to ensure customer service excellence


**Who You Are**
* Degree in engineering or equivalent experience in B2B sales (experience with heat exchangers is highly valued)
* Self-driven, structured, and results-oriented
* Comfortable interacting with diverse stakeholders and building internal networks
* Fluent in a Scandinavian language and English (additional languages are a plus)
* Flexible team player, adaptable, and enjoys challenges


**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Career growth and development opportunities
* Supportive, inclusive work culture
* The chance to make a real impact in a global company


**What’s In It For You**
 You will join a highly dedicated and professional team working in a growing business area. It is a very dynamic environment where we together create value and support each other. Your work will have an impact on the organization’s success and result.
   

  

**Practicalities**
 Location: Alfa Laval Nordic sites in Lund, Flemmingsberg, Sandvika, Espoo, or Söborg
   

  

**For More Information, Contact**
 Erland Elwin, Manager, Product & Application Heat Transfer, erland.elwin@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Divya Sharma, Talent Acquisition Partner, divya.sharma@alfalaval.com
   

  

**Union Contacts**
 Johan Ranhög, Akademikerna, +46 46 2891664
   

  

 Stefan Sandell, Ledarna, +46 46 367364
   

  

 Monica Anderberg, Unionen, +46 709 623811
   

  

**Apply by 21st November 2025.**
 Applications are reviewed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible. Applications sent directly via email will not be considered due to GDPR.
   

  

 Applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice due to GDPR.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application.
   

  

 We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.  Playing the games is mandatory.

title: Associate - M&A/Private Equity (Mid-level)
description:
**Firm Summary**
 White & Case is an elite global law firm serving leading private equity funds, financial institutions and governments worldwide. Our long history as an international firm means we are perfectly placed to help our clients resolve their most complex legal challenges wherever they may be. We have been in Stockholm for over 40 years and have more than 70 lawyers, including 12 partners. Our core practice areas in Stockholm include private equity, corporate M&A, debt finance, capital markets and dispute resolution.
   

  

 With lawyers operating from 43 locations, working in virtually every country of the world, we have invested heavily in building a high-quality full-service practice competing at the top of the market. We are distinguished by our on-the-ground presence in the world’s key financial markets and our strengths in handling complex cross-border work.
   

  

 It’s not just about our global network of offices and shared service centers; it’s the global interconnectedness of the Firm that our people, and our clients, value most. We work well together across geographic and practice boundaries. It’s one of the reasons we attract and retain cross-border work.
   

  

 Our lawyers are globally minded, enterprising, collaborative and committed to excellence. Our people represent 90 nationalities and speak over 80 languages.
   

  

**Our Practice Area**
 Renowned for our comprehensive expertise and unparalleled commitment to excellence, White & Case's private equity team in Stockholm offers an exceptional opportunity for ambitious legal professionals.
   

  

 As part of our team, you'll have the chance to work on a varied array of matters for major clients providing you with exposure to a wide range of high-profile cases and deals.
   

  

 White & Case is the only leading global law firm with a dedicated private equity practice in the Nordics. Our market-leading team, comprising local Swedish, Finnish, English, and US qualified lawyers, handles significant and complex transactions. With over 40 private equity lawyers, we advise on cross-border acquisitions, disposals, co-investments, and growth capital investments. Recognized constantly as Nordic #1 in Private Equity and M&A by Bloomberg and Mergermarket, and recently named European Firm of the Year by Chambers 2024.
   

  

 What sets White & Case apart is our dedication to excellence, as recognised by leading industry publications such as Chambers and The Legal 500. Our clients consistently praise us for our unwavering commitment to professionalism, exceptional legal expertise, and remarkable responsiveness. At White & Case, you'll work alongside locally highly respected lawyers with a global mindset in all jurisdictions where we do business, gaining invaluable experience and mentorship that will advance your career.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 We are currently looking for mid-level associates to join the Private Equity team in our Stockholm office.
   

  

 As well as possessing excellent academic credentials, you should be commercially minded, with an enthusiasm for the cut-and-thrust of international deal-making. A confident team player, you should enjoy working in a close-knit group and demonstrate a willingness to do whatever it takes to help your colleagues get the deal done. Whilst we as a team operate in a fast-paced deal environment, it is also one where a candidate with the requisite drive and determination will flourish. This collaborative mindset should be balanced with an independent, entrepreneurial spirit that drives you to anticipate clients’ needs and to proactively develop solutions to their problems – both legal and business focused.
   

  

 Working in a client-facing practice, excellent communication and interpersonal skills will also be significant assets – enabling you to form strong professional relationships, and to explain sophisticated legal concepts in clear, precise language that can be easily understood by non-lawyers. Highly organized and deadlines-driven, you should relish the challenge of delivering outstanding work within the short timeframes our clients expect.
   

  

 Ready for the challenges of joining a global law firm, you should be excited by our work, a market leading salary and benefits package, passionate about service delivery, and driven by a desire to maximize your talent.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Swedish Law Program graduation
* At least three to four years of private equity experience
* Strong academic record and intellectual curiosity, creative thinker
* Commercial and business awareness
* Outstanding communication skills
* Strong time management skills, ability to stay calm under pressure when juggling multiple projects
* Excellent drafting skills
* Driven by professional growth
* Strong professional presence
* Client service focus
* Team player
* Strong judgement
* Proactive, resourceful, takes initiative and a self-starter
* Leadership experience is a merit
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required


**Location and Reporting**
* This is a Stockholm based role (Biblioteksgatan 12)
* This role reports to the Private Equity Partners, Stockholm


 If you have further questions, you are welcome to contact our Head of HR. Petra Lindeblad on 08-506 32 300.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 White & Case is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and is committed to creating a fair workplace. It is our Firm's policy to recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other category protected by applicable law.
   

  

 The Firm may modify and amend this job description at any time at its sole discretion. Nothing herein creates a contract of employment or otherwise modifies the at-will nature of employment.

title: Service Specialist, Stock Preparation Equipment
description:
Do you enjoy solving real-world technical challenges and working hands-on with advanced equipment?
   

  

 At Valmet, we are shaping the future of sustainable packaging and paper solutions through innovation, collaboration, and a seamless lifecycle approach. Join us in advancing the packaging and paper business, as we move forward with our renewed strategy to Lead the Way. This means pioneering smarter technologies, expanding our service capabilities, and delivering customer value across the entire lifecycle—from raw material to finished product. If you're ready to make a real impact in a dynamic, future-focused environment, we invite you to grow with us.
   

  

 Valmet’s Field Services carries out maintenance, refurbishment, and improvement projects primarily for customers and technologies within the paper and pulp industries. Our particular strengths include solid experience in executing challenging projects as well as professional interaction with customers in various Stock Preparation processes.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Service Specialist to join our Field Service team** 
 working with Stock Preparation equipment.
   

  

 As a Service Specialist, you will guide and carry out practical maintenance and servicing tasks at our customer sites. You will work closely with our customers in Scandinavia and Europe as well as globally. You will independently prepare and execute maintenance tasks and report completed assignments promptly and in the required manner.
   

  

 What do we expect from you?
   

  

 To succeed in this Service Specialist role, we expect you to have experience working with Stock Preparation equipment, especially disc filters and hydrocyclones. In addition, we value genuine interest and motivation to deliver assignments that create added value for our customers and to successfully solve challenges related to their equipment and processes. Occupational safety and proactive safety development are an inherent part of your work and working style.
   

  

 Alongside independent practical duties, you enjoy teamwork and project management. You are ready to take responsibility and make decisions within your remit.
   

  

 We expect a qualified candidate to have a flexible, proactive, and customer-oriented approach to work. Travelling to customer sites is an essential part of the job, so you must be prepared to travel also abroad. Occasional urgent assignments may also require flexibility to work outside regular hours.
   

  

 Your educational background is in a technical field. You have the skills to communicate fluently in English, Finnish and/or Swedish, both spoken and written. Other language skills are considered an advantage. You possess sufficient IT skills, including mobile tools, and you use Microsoft Office and cloud-based applications efficiently.
   

  

 The Stock Preparation Field Service team is based in Valmet’s offices in Tampere, Finland and Stockholm, Sweden, and we aim primarily to fill this position at one of these locations.
   

  

 What do we offer
   

  

 We offer you diverse and demanding tasks in an international environment, as well as the opportunity for continuous professional growth. At Valmet, you’ll work with highly trained professionals and be involved with leading and innovative technology and interesting customer projects. Our onboarding process and dedicated team will support and guide you as you start in your new role.
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 Interested? For more information about the position, please contact Max Jansson, Manager, SPR Services, tel. +358 40 731 6529 or max.jansson@valmet.com.
   

  

 We review applications as we receive them, so please fill in the electronic application form as soon as possible, but
 **no later than 01/12/2025** 
 . Please attach your CV and salary request.
   

  

 We encourage our employees to a healthier lifestyle by being a smoke-free Workplace.
   

  

*When everything works together*
*Valmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. With over 19,000 professionals around the world, we are the leading global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries, and serve an even wider base of process industries with our automation systems and flow control solutions. Our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.* 
*www.valmet.com/careers*

title: Senior Consultant - Internal Audit
description:
**What you will do** 




 As a Senior Consultant in Klarna’s Internal Audit team, reporting to the Group Head of Internal Audit (GHIA), you will deliver assurance across financial, operational, and compliance processes. You will lead audit programs, execute audit assignments, and collaborate with Control Functions and first-line teams to support strong governance and risk management.
 



 • Plan, execute, and report on audits across multiple entities focusing on risk areas and critical processes.
 



 • Identify and challenge key issues impacting business operations and drive remedial actions.
 



 • Prepare clear and insightful audit insights for management.
 



 • Build strong communication and relationships with stakeholders across the organization.
 







**Who you are** 




 • Experience delivering internal audit or assurance in regulated financial services, banking, or fintech (Big 4 preferred).
 



 • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
 



 • Proven capability in audit execution and analysis.
 



 • Confident communicator able to explain Internal Audit’s value clearly.
 



 • Business partner mindset with ability to challenge norms constructively.
 



 • Proactive, resourceful, and adaptable with high independence.
 



 • Professional, conscientious, and improvement-oriented.
 



 • Enjoys complexity and collaboration across functions.
 







 Please include a CV in English.
 







 Curious to learn more about Klarna and what it’s like to work here? Explore our career site!

title: Head of Group Business Control
description:
*We are now seeking to recruit a* 
***Head of Group Business Control***
*to join Foxway Group. The leading European provider of circular tech with focus on improving sustainability of IT devices by increasing circulatory across the value chain and is well positioned to benefit from secular tailwinds.* 




  





*Foxway Group became a part of Nordic Capital in 2023 and is embarking on a growth journey to become one of the largest circular tech companies in the world. As* 
***Head of Group Business Control***
*, you will hold a critical role in our organization's strategic direction. You will be on a continuous mission to strengthen our financial analysis and planning function with the right processes, systems and nurture a business-oriented culture and skillset. The position reports directly to CFO and is based in Solna,* 
***Stockholm***
*.* 




  





*Take this exiting opportunity to join a rapidly growing Foxway Group and play a pivotal role in shaping its future.* 




  





**Your challenge** 




  




* Responsible to lead and develop management reporting process
 *(including business and sales KPIs)* 
 with focus on run rate, forward-looking metrics and financial/business analysis
* Lead and drive projects to establish new way-of-workings within management reporting, planning process and business intelligence tools
* Responsible to drive and develop the planning processes, i.e., business planning, budgeting, rolling forecasts and monthly estimates
* Lead and drive business reviews meetings from group level including budget, forecast and other decision forums and proactively draw conclusions and proposed actions based on data/facts
* Prepare material and translate data and ideas into Board appropriate information
* Involvement in M&A activities in relevant DD-workstreams (including onboarding of acquisitions to business control process) and tracking and follow-up acquisitions vs value creation plans



  





**Your background** 




  




* MSc or BSc with minimum five years of relevant work experience in FP&A and business controlling, preferable in an organization demonstrating rapid growth with M&A as a key driver. Previous experience from PE ownership and/or listed company is a merit.
* Management consulting background (including transaction services) and been part of rapidly growing companies for years (including M&A) is a merit
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a knack for synthesizing large amounts of information, summarizing issues, and thinking creatively.
* Ability to articulate and translate data and ideas into audience-appropriate communication
* Lead-by-example approach with a natural way engage colleagues and drive projects
* High knowledge and capabilities in various different systems, such as group consolidation system (Aaro), BI-tools (Power BI), Excel and PowerPoint
* Fluent in Swedish and English, spoken and written.



  





 We believe the ideal candidates will have a genuine overall interest in business and a desire to contribute on an ambitious PE-journey, are energetic, motivated and thrive as part of a team. As you will be trusted with a lot of responsibility, we also expect you to enjoy taking your own initiative and working independently. Is this you?

title: Credit Analyst - Solna
description:
**Job Description**
 Billerud is a global leader in superior paper and packaging materials crafted from virgin fiber, deeply committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our innovative paper and packaging challenge conventional standards, aiming for a more sustainable future. With production units in Sweden, the USA, and Finland, and a global team of approximately 5800 employees, we serve customers in over 100 countries.
   

  

**We are now looking for a Credit Analyst for Billerud!**
 As a Credit Analyst at Billerud, you will play a key role in managing and optimizing credit risk across our European operations. You will work on portfolio level with credit assessment and ensure appropriate measures to handle and mitigate risk exposure. This is a dynamic position combining analysis, decision-making and close collaboration with the business. You will not only assess credit risk but also communicate decisions clearly, educate stakeholders and contribute to process improvements during an exciting transformation phase, including SAP implementation.
   

  

 The Global trade risk team operates under the Treasury organization and consists of 4 team members. The Treasury function consists of 8 people, and you will be reporting to Global Trade Risk Manager and located at our headquarters in Solna, Stockholm
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Perform credit assessments of the Billeruds customer portfolio
* Evaluate credit insurance solutions
* Compile and analyze data of the Billeruds customer credit risk exposure
* Develop reports for monitoring risk exposure for stakeholders
* Pro-actively develop our credit processes and system support
* Collaborate with external partners such as insurance companies to mitigate risk.
* Follow-up collection cases
* Become a dedicated business partner for our business segments


 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this position, we believe you have:
   

  

* University degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or equivalent relevant area
* Documented experience and understanding from credit assessment in large organizations preferably from an industrial company
* Excellent skills in Excel and preferably SAP S/4Hana. Experience from Power BI is a plus
* Good communication and presentation skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Experience from international organizations is a plus


**Personal qualities**
 You are a hands-on person, ready to take on simple tasks and mix them with bigger challenges. You combine strong analytical skills with excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. You are structured and detail-oriented, yet proactive and curious to drive improvements. You thrive in a global environment, enjoy building relationships and can handle pressure while maintaining high integrity in credit decisions.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the role you are welcome to contact Åsa Ferdinand-Dreyfus, Recruiting Global Trade and Risk Manager, at asa.ferdinand-dreyfus@billerud.com.
   

  

 If you want to know more about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Julia Åkerlund Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

**Application information**
**Welcome with your application no later than 30th of November.**
 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Being part of a dynamic team within BillerudAn opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Styr- och reglertekniker – Telge Nät
description:
Välj Telge – här får du kombinera affärsmässighet med samhällsnytta och som medarbetare får du frihet under ansvar och möjlighet att påverka.
   

  

**Så här säger Anders Viberg, Gruppchef Anläggningar VA om rollen:**
 ”Hos oss får du inte bara ett spännande och varierande arbete. Du blir också en del av ett team med härliga kollegor och en arbetsplats med hög standard. Vi brinner för att ständigt förbättra och säkra driften i våra anläggningar. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och göra verklig skillnad.”
   

  

 Uppdrag och kompetenskrav
   

  

 Som styr- och reglertekniker arbetar du med underhåll, optimering och dokumentation av VA:s styr- och reglersystem. I arbetet ingår programmering och felsökning i styr- och driftövervakningssystem inom SCADA-miljö. Samt att optimera och utveckla befintlig processövervakning. Du ansvarar även för informationsutbyte mellan VA-enheten och IT-systemförvaltning. Som styr- och reglertekniker ingår du i en grupp som hjälps åt att lösa uppgifter och vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Detta är en ny roll för oss på Telge och vi vill att du är med och formar den rollen.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du
   

  

* Har en utbildning i styr- och reglerteknik, el eller automation på minst gymnasienivå eller motsvarande.
* Har programmeringsvana och några års erfarenhet av arbete med styrsystem. Du är även van vid att programmera PLC och vana av Dripdrop, Mitsubishi och ABB:s styrenheter.
* Har erfarenhet av ombyggnation i styrskåp.
* Är ansvarstagande, självgående och problemlösande med god samarbetsförmåga.
* Ser förbättringsmöjligheter och gillar att arbeta tillsammans med andra.
* Har god samarbetsförmåga och samverkar genom att främja och utveckla andras idéer.


 Om du har erfarenhet av någon eller några av följande är det ett plus:
   

  

* Kunskap om SCADA-system och Cactus Eye, arbete inom VA-verksamhet.
* Kunskaper om styrning av pumpflöden, el-behörighet.
* Vana av arbete med stora processenheter.


 Bra svenska och kunskaper i Office-paketet är andra förmågor som också behövs för den här tjänsten. B-körkort är ett krav. Tjänsten kan komma att omfattas av bakgrundskontroll och säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

**Välj Telge**
 Inom Telge finns alla möjligheter för dig att själv forma din framtid. Här finns det plats att växa, både i sin yrkesroll och som människa. Telge är en arbetsplats med trygga anställningsvillkor. Du som anställd hos oss omfattas av kollektivavtal där viktiga saker som försäkringar och pension ingår.
   

  

 Här får du mindre pussel och mer liv. Att ha balans mellan arbetslivet och den privata sfären är viktig för ett hållbart liv. Så långt det är möjligt at vi flexibla arbetstider där var och en styr över sin tid. Vi har en rad förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till löneväxling så att du kan växla in din lön mot extra tjänstepensionssparande.
   

  

 Läs mer om några av våra medarbetare som valt Telge: Vi valde Telge
   

  

**Mångfald inkludering och trygghet**
 Vi på Telge arbetar aktivt för mångfald och inkludering och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser. En trygg och säker arbetsmiljö är vår högsta prioritet. Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i våra rekryteringsprocesser till chefs- och specialisttjänster och vi genomför återkommande, slumpmässiga drogtester bland alla våra medarbetare.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum**
 30 november 2025
   

  

**Några frågor?**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen? Då är det rekryterande chef Anders Viberg du ska kontakta, på 08-550 212 61. Fackliga kontakter är vision@telge.se för Vision och Magnus Enderin för SACO, du når båda på 08-550 220 00.
   

  

**Är du nyfiken på att läsa mer om oss?**
 Läs mer om oss som arbetsgivare: Jobba hos oss
   

  

 Läs mer om Telge Nät

title: Senior iOS Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Experienced iOS engineer (5–8 years) with a strong track record of shipping high-quality consumer apps.
* Proficient in Swift, with solid understanding of UIKit, SwiftUI, and modern concurrency (async/await).
* Strong grasp of software architecture patterns (MVVM, Clean Architecture, or similar).
* Passionate about writing clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
* Comfortable with testing frameworks (XCTest, Snapshot tests) and CI/CD tools (Fastlane, Codemagic, GitHub Actions, Xcode Cloud).
* Curious, proactive, and eager to improve developer experience and overall app performance.
* Great communicator and collaborator who enjoys teamwork, feedback, and shared success.
* Bonus: experience with Firebase, MapKit, or StoreKit.


**Application deadline:** 
 17-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Client Services Consultant
description:
**Who We Are**
 Magnit is the evolution of work. Serving hundreds of the world's most recognizable brands for the past 30+ years, Magnit offers the industry's first holistic platform for the modern workforce. Magnit's integrated workforce management (IWM) platform supported by data, software, intelligence, and best-in-class services team is key to our clients' success. It can adapt quickly to regional or industry economic shifts, and provides the speed, scale, flexibility, transparency, and expertise required to meet an organization's contingent workforce management, talent strategy and broader organization goals. At Magnit, you'll work with passionate colleagues who collaborate and deliver meaningful results that positively transform the largest companies around the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Client Services Consultant, you will be responsible for the efficient delivery of Magnit's MSP "Managed Service Provider" services to one of our biggest clients. Located in Stockholm, Sweden. You will be working closely with vendors, client hiring managers, and Magnit cross-functional teams, utilizing our award-winning software, VMS to ensure smooth service delivery.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* You will be responsible for the day-to-day delivery of Magnit's services, sourcing candidates and vendors to fulfill the client's needs.
* Build and maintain a strong relationship with vendors, the customer's Hiring Managers, and other stakeholders
* Facilitate the fulfillment of requisitions and efficiently manage the relationship/interaction of vendors and Hiring Managers
* Screening CVs and forwarding a shortlist to Hiring Managers
* Bill Rate negotiations with vendors and evaluation of candidates
* Resolve and follow through, in a timely manner, all issues related to the candidate, hiring manager and staffing agency
* Lead monthly operational meetings with the Customer's Hiring Managers.
* Follow & maintain SOP “Standard Operating Procedures”, ensuring day-to-day procedures functions efficiently


**What You Will Need**
* Bachelor's degree or similar work experience
* 2+ years of experience working in a relevant area such as staffing industry operations, procurement, HR/recruiting, MSP or customer service is preferred
* A customer and detail oriented, self-motivated critical thinker with a “Can-Do” attitude!
* Experience with working for clients
* Strong communication skills with the ability to connect effectively across all layers of the organization
* Team player with strong communication skills, both verbal and written in English and Swedish
* Experience from the consultancy industry is a plus


**What Magnit Will Offer You**
 At Magnit, you'll be joining an innovative, high-growth environment and can quickly make an impact to help transform the largest companies in the world. You'll work with passionate colleagues who collaborate and deliver. Magnit offers all employees the opportunity for growth and development, and we want individuals to fulfill their potential and blaze their own trails!
   

  

**If this role isn't for you**
 Stay in touch, we will let you know when we have new positions on the team.
   

  

 To see a complete list of our open career opportunities please visit https://magnitglobal.com/us/en/company/careers.html
   

  

 To do our best work we need different viewpoints. Therefore, we celebrate diversity and embrace inclusion.
   

  

 As an equal opportunity employer, we are dedicated to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strive to ensure that we maintain a positive and enriching work environment for all.

title: Arkitekt IAM
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.
   

  

 För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens IAM-lösningar för Sveriges välfärd och vill bidra till ett digitalt tryggare och mer sammanhållen Sverige? Vi söker en IAM-arkitekt - en roll där du får använda din expertis för att skapa långsiktiga och hållbara lösningar för landets regioner och kommuner.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som IAM-arkitekt blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att utveckla framtidens digitala infrastruktur. Du blir en del av ett team som ansvarar för att ta fram målarkitektur, riktlinjer och strategier för hur identitet och åtkomst ska hanteras på ett säkert, hållbart och effektivt sätt - både nationellt och lokalt. Vi står inför gemensamma samhällsutmaningar där samordnade nationella lösningar, gemensamma principer och hållbar digitalisering är avgörande. I rollen tillhör du IT-avdelningen och arbetar i en sektion som bidrar med expertis inom interoperabilitetsarkitektur och integrationsinfrastruktur. Du blir en del av ett sammanhang som gör skillnad – där din kompetens bidrar till att utveckla digital IAM-infrastruktur som används i hela Sverige.
   

  

 Exempel på ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Ta fram och förankra målarkitektur för IAM.
* Förvalta Ineras referensarkitekturer för identitet och åtkomst, samt elektronisk underskrift och stämpel.
* Verka som lösningsarkitekt för Ineras IAM-förmågor, till exempel SITHS PKI och e-legitimation, Inera IdP.
* Stödja andra arkitekter i frågor som rör IAM.
* Delta i kravställning och upphandling av IAM-förmågor.
* Bidra i nationella samarbetsprojekt mellan kommuner, regioner, myndigheter och andra aktörer.
* Förankra strategier och lösningar för identitets- och behörighetshantering hos våra ägare - kommuner och regioner.


**Kompetens och utbildning**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom it, exempelvis civilingenjör eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete och förmåga att använda arkitektur som ett verktyg för att struktur och utveckling.
* Mycket god kunskap och erfarenhet inom IT- och informationssäkerhet.
* Djup kompetens inom standarderna SAML, OAuth2 och OpenID Connect,


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenheter av IAM-lösningar i federativt sammanhang.
* Erfarenhet av kravställning och upphandling, gärna inom offentlig sektor (LOU).
* Praktisk erfarenhet av etablerade IAM-produkter såsom Keycloak, Ping Identity, Okta, PhoenixID eller Curity.
* Kännedom om relevanta ramverk och profileringar som iGov, IPSIE, FAPI, OpenID4VC, EUIDW.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Entra ID.
* Förståelse för regelverk och ramverk som NIS2 och eIDAS.


**Varaktighet och tillträde?**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
   

  

**Frågor om rollen?**
* Lotten Holm, Sektionschef, lotten.holm@inera.se
* Fackliga frågor, Monica Rosén, monica.rosen@inera.se

title: Biomedical Consultant / Field Application Scientist
description:
**Science is too slow.** 
  The discoveries that could cure disease are bottlenecked by manual work. What if we could change that?
 



  





 At Cytely, we’re not just making discovery faster. We’re building a world where science accelerates itself to unlock human biology and cure all preventable disease.
 



  





 We are looking for a scientist with strong microscopy and image analysis expertise to ensure our existing customers thrive on Cytely’s platform. You will support users after onboarding, helping them gain maximum value, designing additional analysis pipelines where needed, and ensuring long-term satisfaction and renewal. While the role is primarily focused on customer success, it will also include light prospecting and lead qualification.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Support customers after onboarding, ensuring smooth adoption and satisfaction.
* Develop and refine analysis workflows tailored to ongoing customer projects.
* Act as a trusted advisor to maintain strong relationships and drive renewals.
* Identify upsell opportunities and collaborate with the sales team.
* Occasionally qualify new leads and support early-stage discussions.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Advanced degree (PhD or MSc) in biomedical sciences or related field.
* Hands-on experience with microscopy workflows and image analysis tools.
* Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in customer-facing roles, with the ability to build long-term relationships.
* Flexible mindset to contribute to both post-sales and occasional pre-sales activities.

title: Principal Industry Business Analyst
description:
To strengthen our development organization, we are seeking a strategic and industry-savvy Principal Industry Business Analyst with deep hands-on experience from sectors such as Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete Manufacturing, or Process Manufacturing. This is a prime opportunity for a professional who understands ERP both from a business and technical perspective and who is passionate about driving product innovation at the heart of our solutions.
   

 This role is ideal for someone who has worked closely with ERP systems—whether in consulting, customer-facing roles, or as a key user—and who wants to leverage that experience to help shape and evolve our product portfolio.
   

  

 Your Role
   

 As a Principal Industry Business Analyst, you will be the authoritative voice of industry within Product Development. Collaborating closely with the Industry Product Manager, you will help define and prioritize the product roadmap to ensure new features and enhancements directly address real-world business challenges and industry trends.
   

 You will act as a Product Owner in agile teams, taking responsibility for clarifying requirements, defining detailed use cases, and ensuring development outputs meet the highest standards of industry relevance and customer value. Your engagement will also extend to selected customer interactions, gathering critical insights that shape our product vision and strategy.
   

 In this pivotal role, your deep industry knowledge, structured analytical approach, and excellent communication skills will bridge the gap between market needs and technical execution.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 \* Serve as the trusted industry expert within Product Development teams.
   

 \* Collaborate on roadmap planning by conducting thorough market research and industry analysis, translating the roadmap into actionable development plans.
   

 \* Decompose complex business challenges into clear, prioritized requirements and user stories.
   

 \* Document and manage comprehensive use cases and feature sets reflecting industry standards.
   

 \* Define high-level solution designs that align with industry best practices.
   

 \* Own and manage the product backlog within agile delivery teams.
   

 \* Advocate for the customer perspective throughout the development lifecycle.
   

 \* Stay informed on Infor technologies and emerging industry trends to inform product innovation.
   

 \* Support initiatives involving GenAI/ML by providing industry-specific expertise and use cases.
   

 \* Develop industry-specific content, including widgets, process catalogs, persona-based workspaces, and composite applications.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 \* Experienced professional with industry knowledge in Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing.
   

 \* Familiarity with Infor M3 and/or ERP implementation projects is highly valued.
   

 \* Strong ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
   

 \* Exceptional communicator, comfortable presenting and writing for diverse audiences.
   

 \* Proven track record in customer-facing roles, adept at building relationships and gathering actionable insights.
   

 \* Self-driven with excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills.
   

 \* Balanced mindset blending business acumen with technical understanding.
   

 \* Fluent in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
   

  

 If you have hands-on experience working with ERP solutions—particularly within consulting or as a key user in relevant industries—this role offers an ideal platform to influence the future of industry-focused software. Join us and be part of a team shaping innovation and delivering real impact.
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
   

  

 For more information visit [1] www.infor.com
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. https://www.infor.com/
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the [2] FAQ section.
   

  

 Fraud Awareness
   

  

 We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our [3] guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams.
   

  

 Fraud Privacy Policy
   

  

 We value your privacy at Infor. You may access our privacy policy [4] here.
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. http://https//www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
   

 2. https://www.infor.com/about/careers/faq
   

 3. https://dam.infor.com/api/public/content/b45f298e1ab44b84ac898d759b2c21f7?v=3994f5e9
   

 4. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

title: Group Head of Supply Chain Development
description:
***Group Head of Supply Chain Development***




  





**Application Deadline:** 
 Nov. 23, 2025
 



**Location:** 
 Kista, Mäntsälä
 



  





 As a part of our journey towards one company, we are looking for an experienced and development-oriented professional to strengthen our supply chain and logistics operations across the Nordics.
 



  





**As Group Head of Supply Chain Development** 
 , you will be responsible for planning and driving development initiatives within End-to-End supply chain and logistics operations. Your mission is to improve efficiency, quality, and cost-effectiveness through modern tools, digitalization, automation projects, advanced analytics, and the implementation of LEAN principles. In this job role you get to collaborate closely with your amazing colleagues in local units, IT teams, and business leadership across the Nordic region.
 



  





 As Group Head of Supply Chain Development you will report to the Chief Supply Chain Officer and will be part of the Supply Chain Management team.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities:** 



* Leading a team of professional Project and System Specialists
* Leading and supporting IT system development and rollouts (e.g. WMS, ERP, others) while acting as a bridge between business and technology
* Mapping, analyzing, and harmonizing supply chain and logistics processes across the Nordics
* Defining KPIs, building monitoring models, and developing automated reporting for management needs
* Leveraging analytics and visualization tools (Qlik Sense, Power BI) to drive data-based decision-making and improve operational performance
* Driving LEAN practices and fostering a culture of continuous improvement
* Running RFQ processes for external solutions like automation, 3PL solutions, distribution providers
* Preparing and implementing automation projects to increase efficiency and scalability
* Preparing business case calculations and supporting decision-making for investments and development initiatives
* Promoting best practice sharing and alignment between Nordic operations



  





**What we expect from you:** 



* Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Logistics, or equivalent field
* Over 10 years of proven experience in leading and developing SCM operations, preferably in the Nordics
* Solid knowledge and hands-on experience with IT systems such as WMS, ERP, and other supply chain platforms
* Proven experience in preparing and implementing automation projects, both physical and digital environment, covering preferably ML/AI based solutions
* Strong track record in LEAN and process improvement methods, with the ability to implement them in practice with proven results
* Excellent analytical skills and experience preparing financial impact assessments from business perspective
* Knowledge of mathematical algorithms and analytical methods for supply chain optimization (Network, Transportation, Operations, Distribution), leveraging operations research methods to improve efficiency and reducing End-to- End Supply Chain Management costs
* Strong communication and collaboration skills in an international environment, experience of leading operations is considered an advantage
* Experience with reporting and analytics tools, particularly Qlik Sense (Power BI is an advantage)
* Readiness to travel in the Nordics approximately 30 – 50 days annually



  





**What we offer** 



* A key role in shaping and improving supply chain solutions across the Nordics
* An opportunity to lead strategic development projects and deliver tangible business impact
* A dynamic, international working environment with cross-functional collaboration
* The chance to combine analytics, automation, technology, and process development into practical business solutions



  





 In addition to interesting tasks and great colleagues, we offer a competitive salary, staff discounts in our stores and opportunities for growth and learning.
 



  





 We currently work in a hybrid model. Your workplace is located at Tokmanni’s Head Office in Mäntsälä, Finland or in Dollarstore’s Head Office in Kista.
 



  





 Are you ready to make an impact? Apply now and help us shape the future of supply chain excellence!
 



  





 Great, let’s get started! Apply preferably right away, but no later than November 23rd, 2025. We’ll start reviewing the applications already during the application period.
 



  





 For more information, contact Chief Supply Chain Officer Nina Anttila tel. +358 504869810 on November 11th between 9 and 11 Finnish time or November 19th between 12 and 13 Finnish time, or by email at nina.anttila@tokmanni.fi.
 



  





**About the company** 




 At Tokmanni, low prices bring joy and benefit, while also making our customers’ lives easier. We work together towards this goal, offering not only low prices but also pleasant and effortless shopping experiences in our stores, along with a wide range of responsibly sourced and produced products.
 



  





 Tokmanni Group Corporation is one of the leading discount retail chains in the Nordic countries. To ensure a successful customer experience, we work with a team of over 6,000 employees across more than 370 Tokmanni, Dollarstore, Bigdollar, Click Shoes, and Shoe House stores, as well as our online shops.
 



  





 In 2024, Tokmanni Group's revenue was EUR 1,675 million and comparable EBIT amounted to EUR 100 million. Tokmanni Group Corporation's shares are listed on Nasdaq Helsinki.
 



  





 For us at Tokmanni Group, it is essential to operate in accordance with our values, caring for both the environment and people. We encourage and support our staff in developing their skills and foster a positive team spirit.
 



  





 We continuously open new stores and recruit talented individuals with diverse skill backgrounds for various job positions.
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Nina Anttila
 



 nina.anttila@tokmanni.fi
 



 +358 504869810

title: Reverse Engineer av mjukvara
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Just nu söker vi dig med kunskap i reverse engineering av mjukvara som vill utvecklas i din roll hos oss. På FRA är varje arbetsuppgift en del av något större. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv miljö där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag.*
**Ditt uppdrag**
 Du kommer tillhöra kryptokontoret under avdelningen för cyberverksamhet. Avdelningen ska bidra till att stärka skyddet mot kvalificerade IT-angrepp från utlandet hos samhällsviktig verksamhet i Sverige samt att utveckla och leverera access- och exploateringsförmåga till signalunderrättelseverksamheten. Du kommer arbeta vid ett kontor vars uppdrag är att stödja signalunderrättelse- och informationssäkerhetsverksamheten med kryptologiska utmaningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i en enhet som arbetar med kryptoverksamhetens produktion. Din roll består i huvudsak av reverse engineering av mjukvara och analys av kodbaser inriktat mot kryptoimplementationer. Det kan även förekomma utveckling av verktyg för automatiserad kodanalys, samt uppsättning av testmiljöer.
   

  

 Du kommer till en kreativ miljö med en mångfald av expertis inom kryptologi, matematik och IT-säkerhet, där vi tar tillvara varandras idéer och aktivt hjälps åt för att tillsammans nå resultat. Förutom samarbetet med din enhet så samverkar du med övriga delar av avdelningen för Cyberverksamhet samt med andra delar av myndigheten.
   

  

 Resor i tjänsten kan förekomma såväl inom Sverige som internationellt.
   

  

**Du kan**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* En akademisk examen inom tekniskt område så som cybersäkerhet, datateknik, datalogi, kryptologi, matematik eller fysik.
* Kunskap inom reverse engineering av mjukvara
* God vana att arbeta i Linux-liknande operativsystem på kommandoradsnivå
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Kunskaper inom ett eller flera av följande områden:
+ Java, Kotlin, ObjectiveC och/eller Swift
+ C/C++ eller andra lågnivåspråk
+ Android och/eller iOS
+ Kompilatorer och datorarkitekturer
+ Standardimplementationer av kryptofunktionalitet (t.ex. OpenSSL, BouncyCastle)
+ Kontainerisering och/eller virituella maskiner
+ Arbetslivserfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling, designmönster och systemarkitektur


 Du kommer ha goda möjligheter att lära dig mer om ovanstående områden i tjänsten.
   

  

**Du är**
 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ser nedan egenskaper som särskilt viktiga i denna roll:
   

  

* Samarbetsförmåga: Arbetar bra med andra människor. Relaterar sig till dem på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt. Lyssnar, kommunicerar och löser meningsskiljaktigheter på ett konstruktivt sätt.
* Självgående: Tar ansvar för sin uppgift. Strukturerar själv sitt angreppssätt och driver sina processer vidare.
* Utvecklingsorienterad: Har lätt för att ta till sig och se möjligheter med nya idéer, metoder och arbetssätt. Driver och implementerar förändring.
* Problemlösande analysförmåga: Arbetar bra med komplexa frågor. Analyserar och bryter ner problem i sina beståndsdelar och löser komplicerade problem.


**Om FRA**
 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna och trygga. Utöver en stimulerande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi också ett attraktivt förmånspaket, som du kan läsa mer om på www.fra.se . För mer information om Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter besök www.ncsc.se
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

**Mer information**
 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. I denna rekryteringsprocess kommer arbetsprov att tillämpas.
