title: Tech Lead - Android
description:
We’re looking for an experienced
 **Android Developer** 
 , preferably with
 **Tech Lead experience** 
 .
   

  

 The ideal candidate has strong experience
 **refactoring large codebases** 
 , transforming
 **legacy code into modern, scalable architectures** 
 . You’ll play a key role in
 **defining the right foundation and structure** 
 to ensure our app can continue to
 **scale and perform efficiently** 
 .
   

  

 We’re a
 **small team with a big impact** 
 , building and maintaining apps used by
 **millions of users** 
 . This role is hands-on and will focus on
 **modernizing, optimizing, and scaling** 
 our Android applications.
   

  

**Start: Flexible, now or after Christmas**
**Duration: 6 months initially**
**Location: Hybrid setup from Stockholm (2-3 days per week in the office)**
**Main Responsibilities:**
* Lead the architecture, modernization, and technical direction of our Android app used by millions of users worldwide.
* Define a scalable, modular architecture and guide the transition toward modern Android technologies and best practices.
* Collaborate with iOS and Android engineers, designers, QAs, backend engineers, and product owners to deliver world-class mobile experiences.
* Refactor and modernize existing code - improving performance, reliability, and maintainability.
* Drive adoption of Kotlin best practices, Jetpack Compose, Coroutines, and modularization.
* Own and evolve CI/CD pipelines, ensuring fast, automated, and reliable build and release processes.
* Serve as a technical mentor and leader, coaching engineers and fostering a culture of craftsmanship and learning.
* Lead architecture reviews, code reviews, and performance audits, ensuring technical excellence across the app.
* Partner with backend and product teams to ensure a cohesive, scalable end-to-end system design.
* Champion code quality, testing, and observability, building a foundation for sustainable growth.


**Key Requirements:**
* Senior Android engineer (10+ years) with deep Kotlin expertise and experience leading large-scale app development.
* Proven ability to design and implement modern Android architectures (Clean Architecture, MVVM, modularized systems).
* Experienced with Jetpack Compose, Coroutines, Flow, and the latest Android SDKs.
* Strong understanding of app performance, memory management, and concurrency.
* Comfortable designing and improving CI/CD workflows (Gradle, GitHub Actions, Codemagic, Firebase App Distribution).
* Passionate about testing, reliability, and automation (JUnit, Espresso, MockK, etc.).
* Excellent communicator who can align engineering, product, and design teams around a shared vision.
* Proactive, pragmatic, and comfortable balancing long-term architecture with short-term delivery.
* Experience with Firebase, Maps/Location APIs, or modular multi-module projects.

title: Sr. Quantitative Developer
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For:**
 We are seeking a knowledgeable and experienced Senior Quantitative Developer to join our team in Stockholm. This role necessitates extensive expertise in fixed income instruments pricing and risk management. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our solutions and ensuring we remain at the forefront of the financial technology landscape.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Analyze existing and potential functional gaps to ensure continuous theoretical pricing of fixed income instruments.
* Design, develop, and maintain theoretical models and any additional tools required for pricing and risk management of fixed income instruments and derivatives.
* Communicate clearly the chosen design and underlying rationale to stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and deliver tailored solutions.


**Profile Needed:**
**Mandatory:**
* Proficiency in C++ (including STL, C++17) with the ability to write clean and efficient code.
* Extensive experience in theoretical pricing and risk management of fixed income instruments and their derivatives.
* At least 6 years of relevant software development experience.


**Beneficial:**
* Some knowledge of C# and/or Python.
* Fluency with git, bash, make, latex, Jupyter.
* Advanced Linux/Unix experience as a user or administrator.
* Some user experience with Atlassian Jira.
* Any experience with TBricks app development.


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.
   

  

**Use of AI in Hiring**
 As part of the recruiting process, Broadridge may use technology, including artificial intelligence (AI)-based tools, to help review and evaluate applications. These tools are used only to support our recruiters and hiring managers, and all employment decisions include human review to ensure fairness, accuracy, and compliance with applicable laws. Please note that honesty and transparency are critical to our hiring process. Any attempt to falsify, misrepresent, or disguise information in an application, resume, assessment, or interview will result in disqualification from consideration.

title: Industry Business Analyst
description:
### **General information**

Country
Sweden
City
Linkoping
Job ID
46573
Department
Development
### **Description & Requirements**

To strengthen our development organization, we’re looking for a strategic and industry-savvy Business Analyst with hands-on knowledge from sectors such as Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing, This is an excellent opportunity for someone who understands ERP from both a business and technology perspective—and is ready to make an impact at the core of product innovation.
This role also offers an exciting path for those who’ve worked closely with ERP solutions in customer or consulting settings and are ready to contribute directly to product development. **Your Role:**
As an Industry Business Analyst, you’ll represent the voice of the industry inside Product Development. Working in close partnership with the Industry Product Manager, you’ll help shape the product roadmap and ensure that features are developed in alignment with real-world industry needs.
You’ll act as Product Owner in agile teams, clarify requirements, define use cases, and ensure development output remains industry-relevant and customer-centric. You’ll also lead or participate in select customer engagements to gather insights that directly inform our product strategy.
This is a key role where your industry knowledge, structured thinking, and communication skills will bridge the gap between market needs and development execution. **Key Responsibilities:*** Serve as an industry expert within Product Development
* Contribute to roadmap preparation through research and industry analysis, taking the road map into development plan
* Break down complex business problems into clear, actionable requirements
* Capture, document, and prioritize use cases and features
* Define high-level solution designs aligned with industry standards
* Own and manage the product backlog in agile teams
* Act as a customer advocate in development discussions
* Stay current on Infor technologies and industry trends
* Support innovation initiatives around GenAI/ML with Industry competence and use cases
* Create Industry use cases for content, like Widgets, Process Catalogs, Persona based Workspaces and Composite Applications

 **Who You Are:*** Industry experience in Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing
* Knowledge of Infor M3 would be valued and/or ERP implementation experience
* Skilled at analyzing business needs and translating them into technical solutions
* Effective communicator, both in writing and in presentations
* Experienced working in customer-facing roles
* Self-motivated with strong time management and problem-solving skills
* Comfortable balancing business insight with technical depth
* Fluent in Swedish and English - speaking and writing

  

If you have experience working closely with ERP solutions—particularly within consulting or as key user within the relevant Industries, this could be the ideal next step in your career. Join us in shaping the future of industry-driven software.  


  

**About Infor**  

Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.  

For more information visit www.infor.com  


**Our Values**  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section. **Fraud Awareness**  

We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams. **Fraud Privacy Policy**  

We value your privacy at Infor.
company_description: Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry-specific markets.

title: Receptionist Scandic Billingen
description:
Mitt i Skövdes stadskärna hittar du oss, fem steg från tågstationen - Scandic Billingen, den perfekta utgångspunkten för både gäster och medarbetare. Vårt hotell ligger i en anrik byggnad där vi bland annat har en festvåning med tio meter i takhöjd och där vi mer än gärna har stora evenemang. I det lokala arbetet för Skövde som stad är vi mycket engagerade. Vi är mycket stolta över den gemenskap och glädje som vi medarbetare har tillsammans på Scandic Billingen. Vi hjälper till där det behövs, stöttar varandra och uppmuntrar framförallt varandra till utveckling.


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Billingen.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en anställning för enstaka dagar på extra vid behov.

Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.

title: Presales Manager, Domain Consulting - Cortex (Northern Europe)
description:
**Company Description** **Our Mission**


At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:


Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  

Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**


This role is remote, but distance is no barrier to impact. Our hybrid teams collaborate across geographies to solve big problems, stay close to our customers, and grow together. You will be part of a culture that values trust, accountability, and shared success where your work truly matters.

 **Job Description** **Your Career**


As Domain Consultant Manager, you are the technical leader for your Domain Consultant team for Northern Europe (Benelux & Nordics). Your team provides technical expertise and guidance in customers’ security operations transformation journey. You will work closely with the Presales Managers and their District Sales Manager counterparts to build relationships with your customers with the goal of helping them detect and prevent advanced cyberattacks and breaches. You and your team will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives and will evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security services that establish Palo Alto Networks as a customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice.


We are looking for a leader to develop our Domain Consultant teams, providing training and technical support as a product expert. Additionally, you will provide feedback to the product management team on new feature requests and product improvements based on what you learn from your customer base. Your team, in partnership with the systems engineering team, will displace competitor technologies and build market share within your targeted list of major accounts, and most importantly, help your client sleep at night as they use our products to build secure digital transactions.  

  

**Your Impact**

* Recruit and hire new Domain Consultants into the team, hiring the best talent in the industry
* Work with your peers to develop a Domain Consultant training curriculum
* Mentor, train, and review Domain Consultants on your team, keeping them engaged and successful in their careers
* Develop relationships with the Solutions Consultant Managers and their teams to ensure full technology coverage in key opportunities
* Lead your team to innovate and iterate to drive high technical validation and PoC win rates for Cortex solutions, while reducing technical validation and PoC timelines
* Provide effective technical leadership in customer interactions to include sharing security operations trends and standard methodologies employed by other customers to actively be part of the selling process
* Provide Domain Consultant expertise and fill in for existing team members if there is a resource conflict or vacation coverage challenge
* Present to customers as our expert in your area at all levels in the customer hierarchy from technician to CIO
* Lead conversations focused on industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape
* Discuss competitor offerings in the marketplace and positions ours as the best solution
* Support your team in documenting HLD (High Level Design) and key use cases to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Review and guide your team’s technical validation plans including POV (proof of value) test plans and customer readiness/requirements
* Build and maintain relationships with key customers to solidify reference accounts and to assist the account teams with defining plans to drive more business
* Act as an escalation point for presales and collaborate with post-sales teams for issues that arise
* Work with product teams to build requirements and roadmap development plans for our Cortex customers
* Maintain an understanding of competitor selling strategies and technologies
* Up to 50% travel within assigned region

  

**Qualifications** **Your Experience**

* Experience leading customer-facing presales engineering or solutions architect teams
* Significant experience in sales engineering within SIEM, SOAR, SOC, and/or endpoint environments
* Industry knowledge of security operations market trends and awareness of our roadmap and technology development efforts
* Experience delivering comprehensive security solutions
* Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills
* Experience in leading large teams, allocating resources, managing engagements and resource efficiency
* Proficiency in English language skills

  

**Additional Information** **The Team**


Our Domain Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.


As part of our team, you’ll support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our presales team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.

**Our Commitment**  

  

We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.


We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.


Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
company_description: Your career will have a global impact: one that protects our way of life in the digital age by preventing successful cyberattacks.

title: Legal Counsel
description:
Vi på Iver brinner för innovationer och god laganda, vi är särskilt intresserad av dig som gillar att tänka nytt och dela med dig av dina tankar. Vi söker en Legal Counsel som vill bidra till bättre IT-lösningar för våra kunder. Är du vår nya kollega?
  
We empower our Nordic society Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 300 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 23 kontor i Norden.
  
Din roll på Iver Iver söker en vass Legal Counsel till vårt team. I denna nyckelroll kommer du att arbeta nära olika avdelningar på Iver men med basen i det kommersiella. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
  
**Kontraktshantering:** Standardisera mallar, playbooks och godkännandeflöden. Gör avtal snabba, repeterbara och skalbara.
  
Samarbeta med säljteamet under komplexa förhandlingar.
  
Driva initiativ inom GDPR, DORA, NIS2, AI Act och ISO 27001 i samarbete med Ivers avdelning för regelefterlevnad.
  
Stöd vid behov i leverantörs- och partnerskapsavtal.
  
Underhålla och ta fram interna policyers.
  
Utbilda organisationen för att säkerställa medvetenhet om avtalsvillkor och regler vid behov.
  
Hantera tvister
  
Vad erbjuder vi dig? På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska utvecklas. Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för "The Iver way". Förmåner hos oss: Kollektivavtal & trygga villkor Hybridarbete Friskvårdsbidrag Terminalglasögon Tidsbank – 24 h extra ledighet/år Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring Tjänstepension (ITP) & flexpension
  
  

Vem söker vi?
  
Du strävar efter att ge god juridisk rådgivning och arbeta proaktivt och affärsmässigt för organisationens bästa.
  
Du är konsekvent och flexibel i en snabbrörlig och ibland varierande miljö med flera intressenter.
  
Nyfiken, självmotiverad och engagerad i ett kontinuerligt lärande.
  
Du har en stark förmåga att etablera goda relationer och samarbeta med människor på alla nivåer inom organisationen.
  
Vi tror att du är analytisk och har en problemlösande attityd med förmåga att effektivt hantera komplexa uppgifter och prioriteringar.
  
En god stilistisk förmåga i engelska och svenska, norska är meriterande
  
  

**Kompetens och erfarenhet:**  

Juristexamen eller motsvarande juridisk utbildning
  
5+ års juridisk erfarenhet.
  
Praktisk erfarenhet av kommersiella avtal och förhandlingar.
  
Erfarenhet av IT-juridik och närliggande lagstiftning
  
Kännedom om ISO 27001 eller liknande ramverk är ett plus.
  
Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska är ett obligatoriskt krav.
  
Erfarenhet av outsourcingavtal är ett plus.
  
Förmåga att hantera komplexa och pressade miljöer och prioritera uppgifter därefter.
  
  

**Placeringsort:** Iver finns på 23 orter i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Solna. Övrig information: Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet, därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser. Sök till oss! Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-20. Välkommen att kontakta selma.becirbegovic@iver.se eller Kajsa.holzwart@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Junior redovisningskonsult som vill växa och utvecklas
description:
Vi söker en junior redovisningskonsult som vill vara med och bygga bolag
  
Vi är ett bolag med drivna ägare som vill utmana branschen och tillföra mer kundnytta genom rådgivning och digitalisering inom redovisning och administration. Cloud Redovisning & Administration startade 2018 och är en fullservicebyrå som hjälper kunder med löpande bokföring, bokslut, årsredovisning, lön, deklarationer samt rådgivning. Idag har vi kontor i Umeå och Stockholm.
  
Om arbetet
  
Som junior redovisningskonsult på Cloud Redovisning & Administration kommer du att få jobba med löpande bokföring och momsredovisning inom en rad olika branscher. Vi förstår att din kunskap i dagsläget är begränsad men hela teamet består av ytterst kompetenta och erfarna kollegor som brinner för att bygga din kompetens. Därför är det viktigt för oss att du både vill och ser potentialen i denna tjänst som ett steg i din karriär, där du på kort tid kommer att utveckla en stark och konkurrenskraftig kompetens inom rollen som redovisningskonsult.
  
Du kommer successivt att få ett ökat kundansvar och arbeta rådgivande mot våra kunder. Därför ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av service eller kundnära roller, då vi värdesätter förmågan att skapa förtroende och bygga långsiktiga kundrelationer. Tillsammans skapar vi en bra tjänst för våra kunder där du och dina kollegor kan erbjuda den bästa servicen.
  
Vem är du?
  
Vi vill att du har en utbildning inom ekonomi men framför allt ett brinnande intresse att utvecklas inom det. Vi är en modern redovisningsbyrå som ständigt strävar efter att utvecklas. För oss är det därför viktigt att du trivs i en miljö där förändring och förbättring är en naturlig del av vardagen. Vi arbetar aktivt med digitalisering och smarta arbetssätt, och vi tror att du ser det som inspirerande att få bidra till och vara en del av den resan.
  
Vi erbjuder
  
På Cloud Redovisning & Administration finns en plats för dig som vill bredda din kompetens och arbeta på ett företag som värnar om balansen mellan arbete och privatliv. Du kommer att ha stora möjligheter att påverka din egen utveckling men också att ha stor insyn i företaget där du kan du påverka och fira framgångar med oss.
  
  

Ta kontakt med oss så tittar vi på vad som är viktigt för just dig.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

* gillar att ha kul på arbetsplatsen,
* är serviceinriktad och vill arbeta i en omväxlande roll med mycket kundkontakt,
* är utvecklingsinriktad och vill vara med och bygga bolag.

title: Content Marketing & Communications Manager
description:
Aurobay Sweden AB is hiring a Content Marketing & Communications Manager.
  
As Content Marketing & Communications Manager, you will lead and oversee all aspects of content creation across digital, social, and traditional media channels, including events.
  
Based at Aurobay’s Gothenburg office and with Global and Group responsibilities, you’ll report directly to the Head of Communications and ensure the development of high-quality, engaging, and brand-aligned content that supports global marketing, communications, and business objectives. You’ll combine creative direction, production management, and operational excellence to deliver compelling stories and visual assets that strengthen Aurobay’s and the whole Group’s brand presence.
  
Skills and experience
  
At least three years’ experience of working with Content Creation and Production.
  
At least three years of content, marketing, or communications experience in the powertrain industry is an advantage.
  
Strong creative vision and storytelling ability, with attention to detail and brand coherence.
  
Excellent understanding of content production workflows, including video, photography, and copywriting.
  
Proficiency with production tools, editing software, and digital content management systems such as Adobe Creative Cloud, HubSpot, Figma, SEMrush, or similar tools.
  
Solid understanding of digital and social media platforms and their respective content formats.
  
Strategic thinker with strong storytelling and editorial skills.
  
Excellent written and verbal communication in English; an additional European language, especially Portuguese or Spanish, is an advantage.
  
Strong analytical abilities to interpret performance data and refine strategies.
  
Collaborative mindset and a good knowledge of diverse cultures with the ability to work effectively across the Group’s global teams and functions.
  
A university degree in Culture, Communications, or a related field.
  
  

Your role
  
Develop and execute an integrated content marketing and communications strategy aligned with brand and business objectives.
  
Lead the end-to-end content production process, from concept development to final delivery, across video, photography, written, and digital media.
  
Translate strategic communication and marketing goals into creative content concepts and execution plans.
  
Oversee the Global/Group level content production calendar, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with campaigns, product launches, events, and corporate milestones.
  
Lead in-house and external production teams, including content creators, creative agencies, freelancers, photographers, and video teams.
  
Collaborate closely with the Global Marketing and Communications teams to ensure content supports campaign goals and key messages.
  
Track and analyze content performance metrics, applying insights to enhance future production strategies.
  
Implement and oversee content review and approval processes, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance.

title: Experienced Test Engineer - Axis Body Worn Solutions
description:
Job Title
Experienced Test Engineer - Axis Body Worn Solutions
Job Description
Experienced Test Engineer - Axis Body Worn Solutions
Are you an experienced test engineer who thrives on analyzing complex systems and ensuring products work flawlessly in real life?
We are now seeking an engineer with solid testing experience to join our Body Worn Test team at Axis. In this role, you will take ownership of test planning and execution, perform hands-on testing across devices, applications, and cloud services, and help deliver high-quality solutions that our customers can trust.
Who is your future team?
You’ll join a skilled QA team responsible for Axis Body Worn Solutions — from wearable devices to applications and cloud services. Our mission is to ensure that every device and feature operates reliably, securely, and delivers outstanding quality in the field.
We collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and stakeholders, sharing knowledge and continuously improving our testing approaches. Together, we make sure that our products work seamlessly for customers in real-world scenarios. You can learn more about our Body Worn Solutions here.
What you’ll do here as Test Engineer?
In this role, you’ll combine a solution level perspective with hands-on testing of devices, applications, and cloud components. Your responsibilities will include:* Execute functional and exploratory tests to simulate real customer workflows and identify potential system issues.
* Plan and run comprehensive tests that cover multiple components and their interactions, ensuring end-to-end reliability.
* Develop and maintain test strategies and plans that account for integration points and dependencies, prioritizing efforts based on risk.
* Evaluate and validate system stability, performance, security, usability, and the overall user experience.
* Work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to detect, analyze, and address defects.
* Drive improvements in test design, methodology, and overall system-level testing practices.
* Identify opportunities to enhance automation and collaborate with the automation team to increase efficiency.
* Coach and support junior test engineers, sharing knowledge and promoting best practices within the team.


Who are we looking for?
You have solid experience in software testing, with a strong emphasis on manual and exploratory testing. You are comfortable performing system- and integration-level testing in complex environments and have a system-oriented mindset, able to understand both the technical details and the big picture.
You are a strong communicator who enjoys collaborating with developers, product managers, and stakeholders, and you take a customer-centric approach, ensuring products work reliably in real-world scenarios. You are also familiar with automation and scripting tools and continuously look for ways to improve testing processes.
You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Additional experience that will strengthen your application: you have experience with embedded systems or IoT devices, performance and load testing, mentoring or supporting junior test engineers, experience with Python, and a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.
What Axis have to offer
One of our greatest assets is our focus on collaboration. We also know that good ideas can come anytime and anywhere and therefore we encourage everyone to contribute and be innovative. If you are a person who likes to make a difference, you will feel right at home with us!
The well-being of the employees is essential to us. We work actively with our culture where team spirit, equal opportunities for all and having fun are central parts. We want you to enjoy working with us! Therefore, we offer great benefits, e.g. flexible working hours, breakfast every day, classic Swedish fika on Fridays, corporate bonus, physical training grants, insurances, your very own Axis bicycle – just to name a few.
Ready to Act?
We believe the hiring process is a two-way street. It’s just as important for you to get to know your potential colleagues, manager, and the culture at Axis as it is for us to learn about you. After all, we want to make sure we succeed together!
If this opportunity sparks your interest and you’d like to learn more, don’t hesitate to send in your application! For any specific questions, feel free to reach out to the hiring manager, Louise Relkman, at +46 46 272 19 96.
Please note that applications will be handled continuously, so don’t wait to apply!
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-12-04*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Industry Business Analyst
description:
### **General information**

Country
Sweden
City
Linkoping
Job ID
46574
Department
Development
Experience Level
MID\_SENIOR\_LEVEL
Employment Status
FULL\_TIME
Workplace Type
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

To strengthen our development organization, we’re looking for a strategic and industry-savvy Business Analyst with hands-on knowledge from sectors such as Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing, This is an excellent opportunity for someone who understands ERP from both a business and technology perspective—and is ready to make an impact at the core of product innovation.
This role also offers an exciting path for those who’ve worked closely with ERP solutions in customer or consulting settings and are ready to contribute directly to product development. **Your Role:**
As an Industry Business Analyst, you’ll represent the voice of the industry inside Product Development. Working in close partnership with the Industry Product Manager, you’ll help shape the product roadmap and ensure that features are developed in alignment with real-world industry needs.
You’ll act as Product Owner in agile teams, clarify requirements, define use cases, and ensure development output remains industry-relevant and customer-centric. You’ll also lead or participate in select customer engagements to gather insights that directly inform our product strategy.
This is a key role where your industry knowledge, structured thinking, and communication skills will bridge the gap between market needs and development execution. **Key Responsibilities:*** Serve as an industry expert within Product Development
* Contribute to roadmap preparation through research and industry analysis, taking the road map into development plan
* Break down complex business problems into clear, actionable requirements
* Capture, document, and prioritize use cases and features
* Define high-level solution designs aligned with industry standards
* Own and manage the product backlog in agile teams
* Act as a customer advocate in development discussions
* Stay current on Infor technologies and industry trends
* Support innovation initiatives around GenAI/ML with Industry competence and use cases
* Create Industry use cases for content, like Widgets, Process Catalogs, Persona based Workspaces and Composite Applications

 **Who You Are:*** Industry experience in Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing
* Knowledge of Infor M3 would be valued and/or ERP implementation experience
* Skilled at analyzing business needs and translating them into technical solutions
* Effective communicator, both in writing and in presentations
* Experienced working in customer-facing roles
* Self-motivated with strong time management and problem-solving skills
* Comfortable balancing business insight with technical depth
* Fluent in Swedish and English - speaking and writing

  

If you have experience working closely with ERP solutions—particularly within consulting or as key user within the relevant Industries, this could be the ideal next step in your career. Join us in shaping the future of industry-driven software.  


  

**About Infor**  

Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.  

For more information visit www.infor.com  


**Our Values**  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section. **Fraud Awareness**  

We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams. **Fraud Privacy Policy**  

We value your privacy at Infor.

title: Integration Architect
description:
### **General information**

Country
Sweden
City
Linkoping
Job ID
46531
Department
Infor Consulting Services
### **Description & Requirements**

Are you a seasoned integration expert ready to take your career to the next level? Do you thrive at the intersection of technology, strategy, people, business processes and innovation? If you’re passionate about building smart, scalable, and future-proof integration solutions — this is your opportunity to make an impact.

 **Location:** Linköping or Stockholm

 **Type:** Full-time

 **Start Date:** Flexible / As agreed

 **What You’ll Do**


As an Integration Architect, you’ll be the go-to expert guiding clients through the full integration journey — from vision to execution. You’ll design modern architectures, develop seamless integrations, and bring systems and people together.


You’ll collaborate with Swedish and international clients across diverse industries, gaining exposure to different business landscapes and the latest Infor enterprise technologies. Beyond projects, you’ll also shape our internal integration work, processes, mentor others, and share your knowledge to help drive innovation across the organization.

 **Your Day-to-Day Might Include**

* Designing and developing integration solutions using Infor tools and platforms
* Leading integration efforts across complex client environments
* Driving requirements, development, testing, and advisory activities
* Collaborating with cross-functional, international teams
* Contributing to internal best practices and continuous improvement initiatives

**?** **What You Bring**

* Proven experience with hands-on experience in system integration
* Strong technical background within Java, XML, XSD, XSLT, REST APIs, JSON, SQL, Python, Web Services, different integration patterns and communication protocols.
* Good understanding of designing integration solutions from a performance perspective
* Good understanding of integration platforms and EDI standards e.g. EDIFACT and ANSI X.12
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, both verbal and writing

 **Extra Credit For**

* Experience with Infor M3 ERP, Infor OS, ION and IEC/MEC
* A curious, problem-solving mindset and a passion for learning new technologies

**❤️** **Why You’ll Love Working With Us**


At our company, you’ll join a team that values collaboration, curiosity, and creativity. We believe great ideas come from great people — and we give you the space, support, and tools to bring those ideas to life.


You’ll work on global projects, partner with forward-thinking clients, and use market-leading technologies that are transforming industries. Most importantly, you’ll be part of a team that knows how to work hard — and have fun doing it.

 **Ready to Connect?**


If you’re excited by the idea of building the integrations that power tomorrow’s digital ecosystem — we want to meet you.

**Apply now and let’s shape the future together.**

  

  

**About Infor**  

Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.  

For more information visit www.infor.com  


**Our Values**  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section. **Fraud Awareness**

### **Description & Requirements**

To strengthen our development organization, we are seeking a strategic and industry-savvy Principal Industry Business Analyst with deep hands-on experience from sectors such as Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete Manufacturing, or Process Manufacturing. This is a prime opportunity for a professional who understands ERP both from a business and technical perspective and who is passionate about driving product innovation at the heart of our solutions.
This role is ideal for someone who has worked closely with ERP systems—whether in consulting, customer-facing roles, or as a key user—and who wants to leverage that experience to help shape and evolve our product portfolio. **Your Role**
As a Principal Industry Business Analyst, you will be the authoritative voice of industry within Product Development. Collaborating closely with the Industry Product Manager, you will help define and prioritize the product roadmap to ensure new features and enhancements directly address real-world business challenges and industry trends.
You will act as a Product Owner in agile teams, taking responsibility for clarifying requirements, defining detailed use cases, and ensuring development outputs meet the highest standards of industry relevance and customer value. Your engagement will also extend to selected customer interactions, gathering critical insights that shape our product vision and strategy.
In this pivotal role, your deep industry knowledge, structured analytical approach, and excellent communication skills will bridge the gap between market needs and technical execution. **Key Responsibilities*** Serve as the trusted industry expert within Product Development teams.
* Collaborate on roadmap planning by conducting thorough market research and industry analysis, translating the roadmap into actionable development plans.
* Decompose complex business challenges into clear, prioritized requirements and user stories.
* Document and manage comprehensive use cases and feature sets reflecting industry standards.
* Define high-level solution designs that align with industry best practices.
* Own and manage the product backlog within agile delivery teams.
* Advocate for the customer perspective throughout the development lifecycle.
* Stay informed on Infor technologies and emerging industry trends to inform product innovation.
* Support initiatives involving GenAI/ML by providing industry-specific expertise and use cases.
* Develop industry-specific content, including widgets, process catalogs, persona-based workspaces, and composite applications.
 **Who You Are*** Experienced professional with industry knowledge in Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing.
* Familiarity with Infor M3 and/or ERP implementation projects is highly valued.
* Strong ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
* Exceptional communicator, comfortable presenting and writing for diverse audiences.
* Proven track record in customer-facing roles, adept at building relationships and gathering actionable insights.
* Self-driven with excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills.
* Balanced mindset blending business acumen with technical understanding.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
  

If you have hands-on experience working with ERP solutions—particularly within consulting or as a key user in relevant industries—this role offers an ideal platform to influence the future of industry-focused software. Join us and be part of a team shaping innovation and delivering real impact.
