*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Supporttekniker till Region Stockholm
description:
Vill du arbeta med IT för framtidens sjukvård och göra en insats som verkligen betyder något för många? Är du van vid att bygga goda relationer med både kollegor och användare?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som brinner för teknik och service, och som vill utvecklas i en spännande och dynamisk organisation. Du har ett starkt kundfokus och tycker om att ge professionell support. Har du erfarenhet av kundservice, telefoni, support och PC-teknik? Då kan jobbet hos oss på Serviceförvaltningen vara rätt för dig!
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 I rollen som IT-supporttekniker blir du en central del av vår kundtjänst på avdelningen Service och Support, som hjälper regionens användare både på plats, via telefon, e-post och fjärrstyrning.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med en bred uppsättning uppgifter, från första och andra nivåns IT-ärenden till telefoni- och applikationssupport, och bidra till att vårdpersonalen på våra akutsjukhus och förvaltningens IT-miljö fungerar smidigt och tryggt. Genom vårt ärendehanteringssystem registrerar du incidenter och ärenden enligt ITIL ramverket och de processer som finns framtagna för serviceförvaltningen.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kan bland annat att omfatta:
   

  

* Ge support på plats på sjukhus/förvaltning, samt via telefon, e-post och remote.
* Hantera ärenden inom IT och telefoni, exempelvis lösenordsbyten, konto- och behörigheter, hård- och mjukvarusupport, klientsupport, applikationsfrågor, livscykelhantering.
* Ge support på plats på sjukhus/förvaltning där vi möter användare, samt via telefon och ärendesystemet.
* Ge support på plats gällande AVK (Audio Video Konferens).
* Registrera, följa upp och säkerställa att ärenden innehåller adekvat information enligt våra ärenderegistreringsrutiner.
* Kommunicera tydligt och enkelt med användare för att säkerställa att informationen är lättförståelig.
* Installation och konfiguration av hårdvara/mjukvara.
* Koordinera med och eskalera ärenden till tredje part-leverantörer när det behövs.
* Delta i teamets kanaler och chattar i Teams och arbeta processorienterat enligt ITIL.
* Samarbeta med operativa incidentmanagers vid verksamhets- och patientkritiska incidenter.
* Kvällsarbete, helgarbete, beredskap kan förekomma.


 Du arbetar enligt de processer som finns framtagna för serviceförvaltningen och rapporterar till enhetschef.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är serviceinriktad, kommunikativ och trygg i mötet med både tekniska problem och användare. Du är van vid att felsöka och ge stöd på ett professionellt och serviceinriktat sätt, och du har lätt att snabbt sätta dig in i nya system och tekniker.
   

  

 Som person är du samarbetsvillig, lyhörd och trivs med att ge service på ett engagerat och naturligt sätt. Du kommunicerar tydligt och proaktivt med både kollegor och användare, och behärskar svenska väl i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Du delar gärna med dig av din expertis och sakkunskap, lär dig snabbt nya arbetsuppgifter och bidrar aktivt till att utveckla enheten och dess arbetssätt. Du har förmågan att prioritera ditt arbete, är stresstålig och tar ansvar för att leverera hög kvalitet i alla uppgifter.
   

  

 För att passa för rollen har du dessutom:
   

  

* Gymnasieutbildning
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från servicedesk/helpdesk/IT support
* God svenska i tal och skrift


 Vi ser det som en fördel om du har erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystemet ServiceNow och/eller ITIL certifiering.
   

  

 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan bifogas CV och personligt brev. När du ansöker kommer du även att få besvara ett antal obligatoriska frågor.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta: enhetschef Service och Support: christine.hallberg@regionstockholm.se.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Det här är en arbetsplats för dig som gillar att ge service och vill att din insats ska göra skillnad. Vi på serviceförvaltningen ska underlätta vardagen för våra kollegor i Region Stockholms kärnverksamheter så att de kan fokusera på patienter, resenärer, invånare och besökare. Vi är 700 personer som arbetar med inköp och upphandling, löne- och personaladministration, ekonomi- och redovisningsadministration, it och medicinsk teknik, användarstöd, lokalservice med mera. Varmt välkommen till en arbetsplats där du blir en del av något större! Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 5 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/6908 | Kontakt: Christine Hallberg, enhetschef christine.hallberg@regionstockholm.se, | Facklig företrädare: Claes Kilgren, SACO 08-12317944, Anne-Lie Vestlund, Vision 08-12314280, | Publicerat: 2025-11-10 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-23

title: Principal Industry Business Analyst
description:
To strengthen our development organization, we are seeking a strategic and industry-savvy Principal Industry Business Analyst with deep hands-on experience from sectors such as Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete Manufacturing, or Process Manufacturing. This is a prime opportunity for a professional who understands ERP both from a business and technical perspective and who is passionate about driving product innovation at the heart of our solutions.
   

 This role is ideal for someone who has worked closely with ERP systems—whether in consulting, customer-facing roles, or as a key user—and who wants to leverage that experience to help shape and evolve our product portfolio.
   

  

 Your Role
   

 As a Principal Industry Business Analyst, you will be the authoritative voice of industry within Product Development. Collaborating closely with the Industry Product Manager, you will help define and prioritize the product roadmap to ensure new features and enhancements directly address real-world business challenges and industry trends.
   

 You will act as a Product Owner in agile teams, taking responsibility for clarifying requirements, defining detailed use cases, and ensuring development outputs meet the highest standards of industry relevance and customer value. Your engagement will also extend to selected customer interactions, gathering critical insights that shape our product vision and strategy.
   

 In this pivotal role, your deep industry knowledge, structured analytical approach, and excellent communication skills will bridge the gap between market needs and technical execution.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 \* Serve as the trusted industry expert within Product Development teams.
   

 \* Collaborate on roadmap planning by conducting thorough market research and industry analysis, translating the roadmap into actionable development plans.
   

 \* Decompose complex business challenges into clear, prioritized requirements and user stories.
   

 \* Document and manage comprehensive use cases and feature sets reflecting industry standards.
   

 \* Define high-level solution designs that align with industry best practices.
   

 \* Own and manage the product backlog within agile delivery teams.
   

 \* Advocate for the customer perspective throughout the development lifecycle.
   

 \* Stay informed on Infor technologies and emerging industry trends to inform product innovation.
   

 \* Support initiatives involving GenAI/ML by providing industry-specific expertise and use cases.
   

 \* Develop industry-specific content, including widgets, process catalogs, persona-based workspaces, and composite applications.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 \* Experienced professional with industry knowledge in Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing.
   

 \* Familiarity with Infor M3 and/or ERP implementation projects is highly valued.
   

 \* Strong ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
   

 \* Exceptional communicator, comfortable presenting and writing for diverse audiences.
   

 \* Proven track record in customer-facing roles, adept at building relationships and gathering actionable insights.
   

 \* Self-driven with excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills.
   

 \* Balanced mindset blending business acumen with technical understanding.
   

 \* Fluent in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
   

  

 If you have hands-on experience working with ERP solutions—particularly within consulting or as a key user in relevant industries—this role offers an ideal platform to influence the future of industry-focused software. Join us and be part of a team shaping innovation and delivering real impact.
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
   

  

 For more information visit [1] www.infor.com
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. https://www.infor.com/
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the [2] FAQ section.
   

  

 Fraud Awareness
   

  

 We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our [3] guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams.
   

  

 Fraud Privacy Policy
   

  

 We value your privacy at Infor. You may access our privacy policy [4] here.
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. http://https//www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
   

 2. https://www.infor.com/about/careers/faq
   

 3. https://dam.infor.com/api/public/content/b45f298e1ab44b84ac898d759b2c21f7?v=3994f5e9
   

 4. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

title: Application Engineer
description:
**Application Engineer**

**About Us**


Freshly backed by some of the top VCs in Silicon Valley, T-robotics is redefining robotics by combining advanced AI for intuitive programming with pre-trained skill models that are experts at industrial tasks. With offices in San Francisco (USA) and Trondheim (Norway), we provide software that gives our users unprecedented ease-of-use and capabilities for their robots, allowing them to think, adapt, and perform complex tasks like any skilled worker.

**About the Job**


We are seeking a dynamic Application Engineer with a commercial mindset to support our sales growth in Scandinavia and EMEA by combining deep robotics expertise with basic sales skills. This role, reporting to the EMEA Sales Manager, serves as the technical bridge between our cutting-edge robotic technology, channel partners, and prospective customers, translating complex technical capabilities into compelling business value. The ideal candidate will lead technical activities in coordination with the sales team, conduct product demonstrations, and collaborate with channel partners and customers to define and facilitate automation solutions.


The position is based in our Trondheim office, or alternatively hybrid in Sweden or Denmark.

**Responsibilities**

* Support the Technical Sales Cycle: Conduct product demonstrations, assess technical needs, and serve as the primary technical advisor through deal closure.
* Define Solutions: Work with partners and customers to define robotic automation solutions, develop technical proposals, system specifications, and ROI analyses.
* Serve as Internal Technical Liaison: Coordinate with operations and R&D to ensure proposed solutions are feasible; provide structured market feedback to influence the product roadmap.
* Build & Maintain Relationships: Establish strong relationships with key technical stakeholders within partner and customer organizations.
* Drive Technical Evangelism: Represent T-robotics at trade shows and industry events; support marketing with technical content and case studies.
* Ensure Customer Success: Oversee the technical project development phase and conduct post-sales follow-up to support satisfaction and identify expansion opportunities.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or a related field.
* 3–5+ years of experience in applications engineering or a similar customer-facing role within industrial automation or robotics.
* Strong communicator capable of explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Ability to assess production processes on-site and provide clear verbal and written recommendations.
* Proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.

**What Will Differentiate You**

* Experience with machine tools and automated machine tending.
* Industry certifications in robotics, automation, or technical sales.
* Experience in verticals such as automotive, food & beverage, or logistics.
* Knowledge of lean manufacturing and Industry 4.0.
* Multilingual capabilities.
* Experience working with channel partners.

**Travel & Work Environment**

* Travel required for customer visits, trade shows, and partner support.
* Ability to work in industrial environments for demonstrations and assessments.
* Ideally based in Trondheim, or hybrid in Sweden or Denmark.

**What We Offer**

* A unique opportunity to work at the forefront of robotics and AI.
* A central role in a rapidly growing startup where your impact is visible.
* Competitive salary.
* A dynamic, international work environment with offices in the US and Norway.

title: Electronics Engineer to Production Electronics, Lund
description:
Job Title
Electronics Engineer to Production Electronics, Lund
Job Description*We are now looking for an experienced Electronics Engineer to join the Electronics team within the Production Systems Hardware group in Lund.*
Who Is your future team?
In the production system hardware group we develop the hardware for new unique Axis production machines from concept to verified product. By each new generation of Axis network cameras new challenges occurs for our production systems. For example more advance optics and audio as well as new features such as radar and thermal technologies that are built into the cameras.
The Electronics team contains of four dedicated electronics engineers specialized in developing electronics and electrical systems for production systems.
What you will do here as an Electronics Engineer  

You will actively be involved in development projects with a focus on simplicity, scalability, repeatability, and quality for optimal production setup. You will be part of cross functional project teams with other competence categories like software and mechanics. You will develop the electrical design and you will verify and validate the solution. Additionally, you will collaborate and have a close communication with Axis R&D department, suppliers, and our contracts manufacturers.
The role includes:* Electrical design of machines, including design of Electric cabinets and cable harness design.
* Selection of component such as motors, relays, sensors and pneumatic parts
* Building and ordering prototypes for evaluation purposes
* Soldering and other practical work tasks on our prototypes
* The role may include travelling, mainly to our contract manufacturers, for approximately 10-20 days a year.


Who are you?  

Are you a structured and driven person with a natural engagement to finalize your deliverables? Do you like to work in a cross functional set up with an open mindset and ability to further develop a creative environment around you? Are you stimulated by challenges and love to solve problems together with others? You are not afraid to help with some practical work when needed? The role gives a wide range of interfaces and abilities to gain knowledge in different areas.
If you are curious, innovative, like to communicate and influence others with emphasis on production engineering, then we believe this is the place for you.  

Qualifications and Experience:* At least a bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering or similar is required
* At least 3 years experience of Electrical design for machines and systems is required
* Experience of the Eplan ECAD program is preferred
* International Production experience or development of production equipment as well as optics or metrology experience is considered an advantage
* Very good communication skills in English are required
* Good communication skills in Swedish are preferred
* Knowledge of CE marking is preferred


Applications will be evaluated on an ongoing basis
What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact.  

Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.  

*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*  

Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.  

To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
If you have questions don’t hesitate to contact Torbjörn Karlelid (Line manager) or Kajsa Binder (Team leader) on +46 46 272 18 00.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-11-30*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
##### **Project description**

DXC Luxoft is a leading global software services company, delivering professional services across multiple business verticals such as finance, automotive, and digital transformation.  

  

The Automotive practice inside DXC Luxoft delivers software projects to a majority of the world's car manufacturers and suppliers for both personal and commercial vehicles. We are known for our Automotive software expertise and for helping our customers with high quality services and deliveries.  

Currently we are growing for our Swedish customers and are looking for Functional Safety experts to join our team. You will be part of our growing organization in Sweden and will be part of developing next generation systems for the Automotive industry in the era of connected, autonomous, electric vehicles.


##### **Responsibilities**


Functional Safety implementation of electronic vehicle functions as per the Safety process at System and Software level, which includes Safety Concept definition and Safety Management activities.


Lead and perform system safety work products e.g., TSC, Safety Case, HARA.


Lead and perform software related work products, safety requirements, safety architecture, etc.


Lead and perform Safety Analysis like FMEA, FTA, DFA.


Perform verification and confirmation reviews.


Support in implementation of Safety process in the project.


##### **Skills**


Must have


Qualification as AFSP (Automotive Functional Safety Professional) from SGS-TÜV Saar or a comparable qualification from an accredited provider.

title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

Bosch Thermoteknik AB in Tranås develops, manufactures and sells heat pumps for the European market. We are approximately 700 employees and from part of the large Bosch Group, which consists of approximately 409,000 employees worldwide.


We work with sustainable simplification of everyday life where the focus is on the environment, innovation and development. In Tranås there is a production unit and a competence and development center. The heat pumps we manufacture draw energy from different sources - the mountain, the water, or the air. We work to constantly be at the forefront and contribute to sustainable energy and a better environment with the goal of creating a simplified everyday life for our customers. In short, we create technology that is **"Invented for life".**

 **Job Description** **Product optimisation and continuous improvement within the lifecycle team. Your contribution to something big:**

* You will be a key player in solving problems related to electrical design of heat pumps and accessories.
* You will break down and solve problems considering requirements for safety, legal, functional, and cost, and come up with pragmatic solutions.
* You will support other departments with analysis and troubleshooting of different systemic issues in lab, production and in the field.
* You will support problem solving in 8D format and risk assessments.
* You will maintain electrical harness CAD revisions working with current and legacy products.
* You will collaborate with internal colleagues and external partners to support EMC & LVD testing.
* You will be hands on and conduct electrical troubleshooting, and testing based on internal and external requirements such as function, EMC & LVD, lifetime, IP etc.
* You will take part and contribute to DFMEA.

  

**Qualifications** **What distinguishes you:**


Preferred skills

* Engineering degree and/or several years working with EMC & LVD questions in a manufacturer’s environment.
* Experience in interpreting EN and IEC standards requirements.
* Electrical troubleshooting and testing according to relevant product standards.
* Ability to work and reach targets independently.
* Experience as an electrical test engineer and/or cable harness designer.
* Experience in electrical testing according to relevant product standards and troubleshooting.
* Self-driven and experienced with various tools for building samples.
* Problem solving mindset.
* Good written and verbal communication skills in English (due to our international working environment).
* Experience using product lifecycle management (PLM) software.


Valued skills

* Electrician/technician experience.
* Knowledge in IEC 60335 and product certification topics
* Experience in AutoCAD Electrical and Siemens NX
* Experience in SAP

  

**Additional Information** **Your future job location offers you:**

**Global Brand & Stability**  

Bosch is a well-established international company with a strong reputation for innovation and quality. Working for Bosch Thermoteknik AB means being part of a stable organization with long-term growth prospects.

**Career Development**  

Opportunities for **internal mobility** within Bosch globally.  

Access to **training programs**, certifications, and continuous learning initiatives.  

Support for **personal and professional development** through structured career paths.

**Innovation & Technology**  

Bosch invests heavily in **R&D**, so employees work on cutting-edge technologies in heating, energy efficiency, and sustainability.  

Exposure to **smart home solutions**, renewable energy systems, and IoT-based products.

**Sustainability & Purpose**  

Bosch has a strong commitment to **carbon neutrality** and sustainable solutions.  

Employees contribute to projects that have a positive environmental impact.

**Work-Life Balance**  

Flexible working hours and **hybrid work options** (depending on role).  

Supportive policies for **family and personal well-being.**

**Compensation & Benefits**  

Competitive salary.  

Pension plans, health insurance, and other benefits typical of Swedish employers.  

Employee discounts on Bosch products.

**Inclusive Culture**  

Bosch promotes **diversity and inclusion.**  

A collaborative environment with a focus on **teamwork and respect.**
company_description: Bosch is a leading IoT company and global supplier of technology and services in the Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology sectors.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
Kickstart Your Career as a Software Test Engineer at Ascom!
  
Are you at the beginning of your career and passionate about quality assurance and testing embedded software? Do you want to be part of a global team that makes a difference every day? Then we have the perfect opportunity for you!
  
This position is to our Swedish site with placement in Gothenburg.
  
**About Us:** At Ascom, we are proud of what we do, knowing that we are making a difference. You will work in a stimulating and diverse environment where you can use your skills in a way that suits you best. As a knowledge-driven organization, it is important for us that our experts share their expertise and help colleagues grow. We offer an open and international environment where personal initiative is both expected and appreciated.
  
  

**What You Will Do:**  

Design and implement manual test cases based on requirements.
  
Execute manual and automated tests and analyze any failures. Troubleshooting.
  
Install and configure test systems in our lab.
  
Participate in reviews of requirements and test cases.
  
Collaborate with colleagues and partners in Ascom’s global organization.
  
  

**What We Are Looking For:**  

Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Electrical Engineering, IT, or Computer Science.
  
Beginning of your testing career but a few years of experience in software testing is beneficial.
  
Familiarity with standard test processes for software verification (ISTQB Foundation or similar).
  
Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
  
Experience in test automation with Python or similar.
  
Experience with agile testing methods.
  
Strong communication and teamwork skills
  
  

**Personal Skills:** We believe you are a responsible problem solver with a sense of ownership and a willingness to learn new technologies. You have a passion for software testing and feel comfortable working with other test engineers and developers to ensure systems are designed for reliability, performance, and quality. You pay attention to detail and are quality-conscious because our products are often used in hospitals or enterprises. If you dare and care to do your very best and make a real difference in your work, you are probably one of us.
  
Why Ascom?Within Ascom Global R&D, you are an important contributor with broad responsibilities and good opportunities to grow in your role. Our culture is reflected by the Ascom Way and its six principles: Customer Focus, Commitment & Accountability, Growth, Innovation, Leadership, we are Ascom. Ascom is a company where you will be able to engage with all parts of the value stream, from development to sales, manufacturing, and service delivery. If you are motivated by making a real difference in your work, you are probably one of us.
  
**Contact and Application:** Are you interested in the job? The selection process is ongoing, so please submit your application as soon as possible through the “apply” button

title: Frontend Developer
description:
The role of the Frontend Developer is to design, develop and maintain the frontend part of our network management system – the SoSmart software suite.
 



  




**Introduction** 

 Smartoptics provides innovative optical networking solutions for a new era of open networking. We focus on solving network challenges and increasing the competitiveness of our customers. Our customer base includes cable and telecom operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, governments and thousands of enterprises. 
 



 The candidate will be part of the R&D team. The R&D team develops complete systems including both hardware and software. 
 



  




**Position summary** 

 We are looking for a frontend developer for the SoSmart software suite. The team is multinational, but this position is seated in our Stockholm office. We are working agile according to the SAFe methodology. Some possibility for work from home, but most days we try to meet in our office in Kista, Stockholm.
 



  




**Requirements:** 
* Based in the Stockholm area
* Office-first policy
* University degree in relevant field, e.g. MSc in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
* Strong foundation in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, as well as experience with at least one modern framework such as React, Vue.js, or Angular
* Understanding of REST APIs
* Good communication skills in English; Swedish proficiency is a plus



  




**Desired skills:** 
* Experience with testing frameworks (e.g. Playwright, Jest, or Cypress)
* Any exposure to MapLibre GL (or similar web-mapping libs)
* Interest in design systems, accessibility, and user experience
* Basic understanding of WebSockets or real-time data handling
* Understanding of microservice architectures and containerization (e.g. Docker)
* Development experience in a Linux environment
* Strong collaboration, problem-solving, and debugging skills
* Familiarity with agile development practices



  





 Smartoptics R&D team is located in Kista with head office in Oslo, Norway. Benefits include pension, health insurance, bonus scheme, 6 weeks’ vacation and flexible working hours. For more information about Smartoptics, please see smartoptics.com/about.
 



 Furthermore, note that you must have a Swedish/EU work permit. No relocation assistance or visa support provided. No recruiters or agencies, please.
 



  





**About Smartoptics** 
  
 



 Smartoptics is a Scandinavian company founded in 2006. We provide innovative optical networking solutions for the new era of open networking. Our focus is on solving network challenges and enhancing the competitiveness of our customers. Our clientele includes cable and telecom operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, governments, and thousands of enterprises. 
 



 At Smartoptics, we value inclusivity and prioritize the well-being of our employees. We foster a positive company culture and provide a supportive work environment.

title: Mobile Core Operations Engineers
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**
 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
   

  

 We are now looking for two
 **Mobile Core Operations Engineers** 
 to join our
 **Mobile Core** 
 team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Mobile communications have entered the fifth generation, and the demand for fast, reliable, and secure mobile services continues to grow across society. We already serve millions of users who depend on our network every day—and with the evolution of true 5G, mobile connectivity will become even more critical.
   

  

 At the heart of this transformation is the Mobile Core: the central component where most services are created, managed, and delivered. The pace of innovation in this area is rapid—traditional network “boxes” have evolved into cloud-native, data center-based solutions.
   

  

 Our Mobile Core team is responsible for both development and 24/7 operations across the entire domain. This includes architecture and design, fault and change management, performance monitoring, testing, automation, troubleshooting, and more. We work in agile teams, adapting in size depending on the task, and always strive to match the right expertise to the right challenge.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a member of the Mobile Core team, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our network remains robust, scalable, and always available. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Participating in the design and implementation of new Mobile Core features and services
* Monitoring and analyzing network performance to proactively identify and resolve issues
* Managing incidents and troubleshooting faults in a mission-critical, 24/7 environment
* Driving automation and continuous improvement across operations and workflows
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery
* Contributing to testing, validation, and deployment of new releases and upgrades


 This is more than just a technical role—it’s an opportunity to shape the future of mobile communications and make a real impact on the services millions rely on every day.
   

  

**Are you the one we’re looking for?**
 We need someone who’s always on their toes! You have a genuine desire to learn and develop so we can continue to meet our customers’ ever-changing needs – today and tomorrow.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative setting and is passionate about mobile technology. You are familiar with some of the following areas, either from studies or from work life. Expertise in all of them is not expected:
   

  

**Technologies & Infrastructure**
* Operating systems (Linux)
* Containers, microservices and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker)
* IP Networking (DNS/Firewall/Routing), Open vSwitch, NGINX, Container Networking interfaces
* Hyperconverged Storage Solutions (Ceph/Rook)
* Mobile Networks (3GPP knowledge)


**Automation**
* Configuration Management (Git, Helm, YAML)
* Software supply chain CI/CD (Jenkins)
* Logging (Fluentd)
* Fault Management (Alert Manager)
* Scripting and Programming (Bash, Python)
* Metrics Collection and visualization (Grafana, Prometheus, Victoria Metrics)
* Continuous testing tools / Test automation
* DevSecOps practices


 Experience from Ericsson cloud native systems and Swedish language skills is a bonus.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager Kenneth Radebo at kenneth.radebo@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email. Last application date is 30th of November 2025.
   

  

**Our promise to you**
**We are better together.**
 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.**
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.**
 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.**
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments. This role will require Swedish security clearance. On-call duties is a part of this position.

title: Vision Software Engineer
description:
**DeLaval Is Looking For a Experienced Computer Vision Engineer**
 There are lots of opportunities for smart vision applications on a modern dairy farm. Today we supervise the condition of the cows and even control robots in real-time via vision. Tomorrow, we plan to do even more. Clever vision solutions will help farmers around the world to run their operations in a more efficient and environmentally friendly way.
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced Computer Vision Engineer for our Data Science & Vision Team. This is a job where you clearly can see how your code will help the end customer every day. A trip to a farm now and then will also give you a better understanding of the environment and the problems we have to solve.
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Develop and maintain computer vision applications for the dairy industry
* Take part in Proof-of-Concept studies and innovation projects
* Evaluate new technologies and tools in the area of computer vision
* Continuously develop and refine our way of working with vision technology


**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Computer Science or similar
* Experience from working with product development in industrial companies
* C++ and OpenCV
* Computer Vision experience – preferrable both traditional- and model-based image processing
* Knowledge about cameras, optics and illumination for computer vision
* Embedded system experience is a plus
* Experience from robotic applications is a plus
* Embedded systems experience is a plus
* Ability to communicate in Swedish


**Personal Competences**
* Collaborative mind-set
* Ability to excel in an agile small team environment
* Curiosity and out-of-the-box thinking
* Not afraid of getting hands dirty on a dairy farm from time to time


**We offer you**
 An opportunity to work with vision applications in a creative and dedicated team with end-to-end responsibility.
   

  

 An exciting position at the forefront of technology in a market leading company with customers all over the world.
   

  

 A possibility to work with software development and vision technology in a different and fun area of application, where you solve real world problems and clearly can see the result of your work.
   

  

 The position will be located in Tumba, Stockholm, and reports to Björn Wiklander, Manager Data Science & Vision Technology. The job may occasionally require some travel to test farms, in Sweden and abroad.
   

  

 Welcome with your application (in English)! We will review applications continuously. The last day to apply is December 20.
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at www.delavalcorporate.com .

title: Hardware System Engineer
description:
As a
 **Systems Engineer** 
 , you are a key player in our projects, participating in defining the system’s design and functionality. You will ensure that the best possible technical solution is developed with regard to requirements and quality, while managing ongoing technical matters within our projects.
 



 You will work closely with our project managers, designers, and installers, and be involved throughout the entire integration process — from defining system requirements and architecture to design, assembly, commissioning, and testing.
 



  





**Examples of work tasks:** 



* Analyze, break down, and realize system requirements, and define how systems should be designed
* Ensure that functionality is feasible and that the design is appropriate
* Ensure that the developed solution meets both customer and internal requirements
* Prepare documentation on how requirements can be tested and verified in the system solution
* Identify and mitigate risks, ensuring that necessary adjustments are made to secure system design quality



 At our company, you’ll work with
 **cutting-edge technology** 
 , engaging in a mix of mechanics, technical equipment, and electrical installations. Our assignments vary over time, making the work both diverse and stimulating. One week you might work on serial production of different systems, and the next, you could be developing completely unique systems based on the current global situation.
 



  





**What you bring:** 



* A technical background, either through an engineering degree, as an electrician who has transitioned into engineering, or equivalent professional experience
* Several years of relevant experience and a solid understanding of hardware, mechanics, cabling/electrical systems, and networks. Experience with software is a plus but not required
* Skills in creating drawings in CAD are meritorious
* Excellent proficiency in both Swedish and English



  





 This position requires you to undergo and be approved according to the applicable
 **security protection regulations** 
 . For positions requiring a
 **security clearance** 
 , certain citizenship requirements may apply.
 



  





**Ready for your next career move? Explore opportunities at** 
**Co-Workertech.com**

* **Co-Worker Technology**
* **Co-Worker Renewable Energy Industry Jobs**



**Follow us to stay updated on the latest news, insights, and exciting announcements from our company.**

title: Cobol Developer
description:
Are you an experienced COBOL developer in a Mainframe environment, looking for new challenges within the interesting and society critical Card Payments Area? If yes, you are perhaps the missing piece in our team!
   

  

 In Card Processing you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Join the team Card Processing unit responsible for the systems and processes related to the card authorization, fraud monitoring & prevention and clearing & settlement for Card Issuing and Acquiring in the Nordics and the Baltics countries.
* Collaborate with experts to develop and maintain BIMS, a CC1 system processing high volumes of card transactions for issuing, acquiring, clearing, and settlement.
* Work with analysis, maintenance, development, test and deployment in Cobol on Mainframe.
* Card Processing is constantly under transformation due to the card scheme updates and PCI DSS requirements. Therefore, it is important for us to add one more Software Engineer to be part of our team.
* Be part of a supportive and fun team, with both senior and junior team members. We support each other and the important business area that we work in!


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Proven experience in COBOL development and Mainframe environments.
* Hands-on experience with Changeman, DB2, SQL, JCL & OPC program.
* Worked with IT support and ITIL tools and processer - Incident, Problem and Change.
* Relevant university degree or equivalent professional experience.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to handle complex programming and testing.
* Team-oriented with excellent self-leadership and communication skills.Experience in card payments, IT architecture, system integration, or Agile (SAFe) is a plus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

* professional colleagues, who work together to deliver great solutions and functionality to ensure and contribute to Swedbank's position in the card industry." Linn Hjortsberg your future manager


 We look forward to receiving your application by 25.11.2025.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Linn Hjortsberg
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.

title: Testande Testledare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Rollen**
* Leda och koordinera testarbete inom sprintar, PI-cykler och värdeflöden.
* Etablera och vidareutveckla teststrategi, testplanering och spårbarhet (krav–testfall–resultat).
* Utföra praktiska tester och analyser av dataflöden, datakvalitet och rapporter.
* Säkerställa fungerande testmiljöer, testdata och effektiv övervakning av flöden.
* Hantera tekniska beroenden mellan team, system och dataflöden.
* Leda och utbilda utvecklare i testpraxis, automatisering och kvalitetstänk.
* Bidra till förbättringar av teamens arbetssätt, exempelvis i samband med PI-planering och retrospektiv.


****Din profil (Skall krav)****
* Erfarenhet: minst 4–6 års erfarenhet av testledning eller teknisk testning i data- eller DWH-miljöer.
* Dataförståelse: mycket god kunskap om datalager, ETL/ELT-flöden och datamodellering (staging, data marts, lineage).
* SQL: förmåga att läsa, förstå och skriva SQL för att analysera och validera data.
* Verktyg: erfarenhet av Azure DevOps Test Plans eller motsvarande verktyg för testhantering.
* Arbetssätt: vana vid lean-agila metoder och PI-planering samt erfarenhet av att arbeta med beroenden i agila tåg.
* Kommunikation: förmåga att skapa struktur, tydlighet och förtroende i samarbetet med utvecklare, verksamhet och andra team.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av finanssektorn och regulatorisk rapportering (t.ex. FINREP, COREP, ECL).
* Bakgrund som DW-utvecklare eller teknisk testare i DWH-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och övervakning av dataflöden.
* Kunskap i Python, dbt tests eller CI/CD-flöden.
* ISTQB-certifiering.
* Erfarenhet av scrummasterrollen.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 13-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Mobile Android Developer
description:
The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for an Android Developer to join the Key Device Cylinders (KDC) product unit.
   

  

 If you are passionate about mobile app development and have a track record of building successful Android applications, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Join our team in Stockholm or Kraków and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

 This is a
 **hybrid position** 
 that requires regular presence in the office - at least twice a week .
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile Android Developer**
 As an Android Developer you will develop mobile applications for our different Key Device Cylinders systems. You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and release new features
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least three years' experience of mobile Android app development, preferably with Kotlin.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with Jetpack Compose and good understanding of Android release cycle.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following: developing mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, and security technologies such as TLS, MFA, OAuth, and PKI. Experience with cross-platform languages such as React Native (Expo), Kotlin Multi-Platform, or Flutter is nice to have but not a requirement. Additionally, familiarity with the SAFe agile methodology is beneficial.
   

  

 Furthermore, you share our belief in lean and agile values, embracing an open mindset and cross-functional teams where multiple competencies collaborate to drive successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Tracab Master Thesis Intern
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Master’s Thesis Internships – Computer Vision & Machine Learning at EA Sports TRACAB (Stockholm)
   

  

 EA Sports TRACAB’s Computer Vision and Machine Learning team is offering several exciting master’s thesis projects for 2026. We are a team of 24 researchers and developers based in Stockholm, applying advanced technology to sports analytics. Projects will run from mid-late January to July 2026.
   

  

**Available Project** 
**s**
* Human Mesh Recovery in Crowded Situations: Advance state-of-the-art human mesh recovery using multi-view sports footage, focusing on challenging crowded scenarios.
* Event Detection: Develop automated event detection models for football by aligning and utilizing player, ball, and event tracking data.
* Football Pitch Localization: Build a machine learning system to accurately detect and localize football pitch features in video footage.
* Creating a New SMPL Model Using Synthetic Data: Design and evaluate a new Skinned Multi-Person Linear (SMPL) model trained on synthetic human mesh data.
* Football Trajectory Modeling: Model and classify football flight dynamics using high-frequency tracking data.


 For more information about our team, visit the TRACAB Official Website.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
